food_items.name: __background__
food_items.recipe: N/A

food_items.name: Chaudin
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 lb pork sausage
- 1 cup cooked rice
- 1/2 cup diced onions
- 1/4 cup chopped parsley
- 1 tsp Cajun seasoning
- Pork stomach casing

Instructions:
1. Mix sausage, rice, onions, parsley and seasoning.
2. Stuff mixture into cleaned pork stomach.
3. Sew or tie ends closed.
4. Bake at 350°F for 2 hours or grill until internal temperature reaches 160°F.

food_items.name: Bambalouni
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 2 cups flour
- 1 tbsp sugar
- 1 tsp yeast
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 3/4 cup warm water
- Oil for frying
- Honey for drizzling

Instructions:
1. Mix dry ingredients and add water to form dough.
2. Knead for 5 minutes and let rise 1 hour.
3. Divide into small balls and flatten into discs.
4. Fry in hot oil until golden brown.
5. Drizzle with honey before serving.

food_items.name: Ghoriba
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 2 cups almond flour
- 1 cup powdered sugar
- 1/2 cup melted butter
- 1 tsp orange blossom water
- 1/4 tsp cinnamon

Instructions:
1. Mix all ingredients to form a dough.
2. Roll into 1-inch balls and flatten slightly.
3. Bake at 300°F for 20 minutes until lightly golden.
4. Cool completely before serving.

food_items.name: Mango sticky rice
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 cup glutinous rice
- 1.5 cups coconut milk
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 1/4 tsp salt
- 1 ripe mango (sliced)

Instructions:
1. Soak rice in water for at least 4 hours and steam it until tender.
2. Heat coconut milk, sugar, and salt in a pot (do not boil).
3. Mix 1 cup of the coconut milk with the cooked rice and let it sit.
4. Serve with mango slices and drizzle remaining coconut milk on top.

food_items.name: Jianbing
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 cup mung bean flour
- 1/2 cup water
- 1 egg
- 1 tbsp hoisin sauce
- 1 tbsp chili paste
- 1 scallion (chopped)
- 1 crispy wonton wrapper

Instructions:
1. Mix flour and water to make thin batter.
2. Pour batter onto hot griddle and spread thin.
3. Crack egg on top and spread evenly.
4. Flip when set and add sauces, scallions, and wonton.
5. Fold and serve hot.

food_items.name: Aguachile
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 lb fresh shrimp (peeled and deveined)
- 1/2 cup lime juice
- 2 serrano peppers
- 1/4 cup cilantro
- 1/2 cucumber (sliced)
- 1/4 red onion (thinly sliced)

Instructions:
1. Blend lime juice, peppers and cilantro into sauce.
2. Marinate shrimp in sauce for 10 minutes.
3. Arrange on plate with cucumber and onion slices.
4. Serve immediately with tostadas.

food_items.name: Carrozza
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 8 slices white bread
- 4 oz mozzarella (sliced)
- 2 eggs
- 1/4 cup milk
- 1/2 cup breadcrumbs
- Oil for frying

Instructions:
1. Make sandwiches with mozzarella between bread slices.
2. Whisk eggs and milk in shallow dish.
3. Dip sandwiches in egg mixture, then breadcrumbs.
4. Fry in hot oil until golden brown on both sides.
5. Drain on paper towels before serving.

food_items.name: Miyan kuka
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 cup baobab leaf powder
- 1 lb goat meat
- 1 onion (chopped)
- 2 tbsp palm oil
- 2 scotch bonnet peppers
- 1 tbsp locust bean paste

Instructions:
1. Boil meat with onions until tender.
2. Add palm oil, peppers and locust bean paste.
3. Whisk in baobab powder to thicken.
4. Simmer for 10 minutes and serve with tuwo.

food_items.name: Efo riro
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 bunch spinach (chopped)
- 1/2 cup palm oil
- 1 lb assorted meats/fish
- 2 tbsp ground crayfish
- 2 scotch bonnet peppers
- 1 tbsp iru (fermented locust beans)

Instructions:
1. Cook meats until tender and set aside.
2. Heat palm oil and fry peppers, onions and iru.
3. Add meats, crayfish and spinach.
4. Cook until spinach wilts (about 5 minutes).
5. Serve with pounded yam or rice.

food_items.name: Ayam masak merah
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 whole chicken (cut up)
- 3 tbsp chili paste
- 1 onion (sliced)
- 2 tomatoes (chopped)
- 1 tbsp tamarind paste
- 1 cup coconut milk

Instructions:
1. Fry chicken pieces until half cooked and set aside.
2. Sauté onions and chili paste until fragrant.
3. Add tomatoes, tamarind and coconut milk.
4. Return chicken to sauce and simmer 20 minutes.
5. Serve with steamed rice.

food_items.name: Chiffon pie
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 pre-baked pie crust
- 1 envelope unflavored gelatin
- 1/4 cup cold water
- 3 eggs (separated)
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 cup fruit puree (lemon, strawberry, etc.)

Instructions:
1. Dissolve gelatin in water and set aside.
2. Beat egg yolks with 1/4 cup sugar and fruit puree.
3. Cook over double boiler until thickened.
4. Fold in whipped egg whites and gelatin.
5. Pour into crust and chill 4 hours before serving.

food_items.name: /g/11b8_rxx4d
food_items.recipe: N/A

food_items.name: Riso patate e cozze
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 cup Arborio rice
- 1 lb mussels (cleaned)
- 2 potatoes (diced)
- 2 cloves garlic (minced)
- 1/4 cup white wine
- 2 cups fish stock

Instructions:
1. Sauté garlic and potatoes in olive oil.
2. Add rice and toast for 1 minute.
3. Deglaze with wine, then add hot stock gradually.
4. When rice is half cooked, add mussels.
5. Cover and cook until mussels open and rice is done.

food_items.name: Bazin
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 2 cups barley flour
- 1 tsp salt
- 4 cups water

Instructions:
1. Mix flour and salt in boiling water.
2. Stir continuously until thick dough forms.
3. Shape into dome on serving plate.
4. Let cool and serve with stew.
5. Traditionally eaten by breaking off pieces to scoop stew.

food_items.name: Black bottom pie
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 pre-baked pie crust
- 1 cup chocolate chips
- 1/4 cup rum
- 2 cups custard filling
- 1 cup whipped cream

Instructions:
1. Melt chocolate with rum and spread in pie crust.
2. Let set for 10 minutes.
3. Pour custard filling over chocolate layer.
4. Chill for 4 hours.
5. Top with whipped cream before serving.

food_items.name: Palóc soup
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 lb lamb (cubed)
- 2 potatoes (diced)
- 1 carrot (diced)
- 2 tbsp paprika
- 1 tbsp flour
- 1 cup sour cream

Instructions:
1. Brown lamb in pot with onions.
2. Add paprika and flour, stir well.
3. Cover with water and simmer 1 hour.
4. Add vegetables and cook until tender.
5. Temper sour cream with some broth before stirring in.

food_items.name: Sailor sandwich
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 loaf crusty bread
- 1/2 lb roast beef
- 1/2 lb ham
- 1/4 lb Swiss cheese
- 1/4 lb salami
- Mustard and pickles

Instructions:
1. Slice bread horizontally.
2. Layer all meats and cheese.
3. Add mustard and pickles.
4. Wrap tightly and weigh down for 1 hour.
5. Cut into thick slices to serve.

food_items.name: Tuwo shinkafa
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 2 cups short grain rice
- 4 cups water
- 1 tsp salt

Instructions:
1. Wash rice until water runs clear.
2. Cook with water and salt until very soft.
3. Pound into smooth, stretchy dough.
4. Form into balls and serve with soup.

food_items.name: Carne a la tampiqueña
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 lb skirt steak
- 1/4 cup lime juice
- 2 cloves garlic
- 1 tsp cumin
- 2 enchiladas
- 1/2 cup refried beans

Instructions:
1. Marinate steak in lime juice, garlic and cumin for 1 hour.
2. Grill to medium-rare and slice thinly.
3. Serve with enchiladas, beans and guacamole.
4. Garnish with grilled onions and peppers.

food_items.name: Pastel azteca
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 12 corn tortillas
- 2 cups shredded chicken
- 1 cup salsa verde
- 1 cup crema
- 1 cup queso fresco

Instructions:
1. Layer tortillas in baking dish.
2. Alternate layers of chicken, salsa, crema and cheese.
3. Repeat for 3-4 layers.
4. Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes until bubbly.

food_items.name: Fujian red wine chicken
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 whole chicken (cut up)
- 1 cup Fujian red wine
- 1 tbsp sesame oil
- 5 slices ginger
- 1 tbsp goji berries

Instructions:
1. Brown chicken pieces with ginger.
2. Add wine and simmer 20 minutes.
3. Finish with sesame oil and goji berries.

food_items.name: Boeber
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup vermicelli
- 1/2 cup sago pearls
- 4 cups milk
- 1 tsp cardamom
- 1/4 cup sugar

Instructions:
1. Cook vermicelli and sago separately.
2. Combine with milk and spices.
3. Simmer until thickened.

food_items.name: Lady Baltimore cake
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 3 cups flour
- 2 cups sugar
- 1 cup butter
- 1 cup dried fruits
- 1/2 cup nuts

Instructions:
1. Cream butter and sugar.
2. Alternate dry and wet ingredients.
3. Bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes.

food_items.name: Yam khai dao
food_items.recipe:

- 1/2 cup fried shallots
- 2 tbsp fish sauce

Instructions:

2. Mix sauce ingredients.
3. Pour over eggs and shallots.

food_items.name: Texas Tommy
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 4 hot dogs
- 4 slices cheddar

Instructions:

food_items.name: Har cheong gai

3. Toss with honey and sesame oil.

food_items.name: Kolokythopita
food_items.recipe:

Instructions:

food_items.name: Bey's Soup

food_items.name: Sop saudara
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 500g beef, cut into small pieces
- 100g beef liver, diced
- 100g beef heart, diced
- 3 tbsp cooking oil
- 5 cloves garlic, minced
- 5 shallots, sliced
- 2 lemongrass stalks, bruised
- 3 kaffir lime leaves
- 2 bay leaves
- 1 tsp coriander
- 1/2 tsp cumin
- 1/2 tsp black pepper
- 1 tsp salt
- 2 liters water
- 200g vermicelli noodles, soaked
- 4 tbsp fried shallots
- 2 tbsp chopped celery
- 2 tbsp chopped green onions

Instructions:
1. Heat oil and sauté garlic and shallots until fragrant.
2. Add beef, liver, and heart, stir until browned.
3. Add lemongrass, lime leaves, bay leaves, coriander, cumin, black pepper, and salt.
4. Pour in water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 1.5 hours until meat is tender.
5. Prepare bowls with soaked vermicelli noodles.
6. Pour hot soup over noodles.
7. Garnish with fried shallots, celery, and green onions.

food_items.name: /g/155q8w2m
food_items.recipe: N/A

food_items.name: Erbazzone
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- For the dough:
  - 250g all-purpose flour
  - 60ml olive oil
  - 100ml warm water
  - 1 tsp salt
- For the filling:
  - 800g Swiss chard or spinach, cleaned
  - 3 tbsp olive oil
  - 1 onion, finely chopped
  - 2 cloves garlic, minced
  - 150g Parmigiano-Reggiano, grated
  - 2 eggs, beaten
  - Salt and pepper to taste
  - Pinch of nutmeg

Instructions:
1. For the dough: Mix flour and salt. Add oil, then gradually add water until dough forms. Knead for 5 minutes until smooth. Cover and rest for 30 minutes.
2. For the filling: Blanch greens in boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain well and squeeze out excess water. Chop finely.
3. In a pan, heat oil and sauté onion and garlic until soft. Add greens and cook for 5 minutes.
4. Remove from heat and cool. Add cheese, eggs, salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Mix well.
5. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
6. Divide dough in half. Roll out each piece into thin rectangles.
7. Place one rectangle on a baking sheet. Spread filling evenly, leaving a 1-inch border.
8. Cover with second rectangle. Press edges to seal. Pierce top with a fork.
9. Brush with olive oil and bake for 30-35 minutes until golden.
10. Cool slightly before cutting into squares.

food_items.name: Kisra
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 500g sorghum flour
- 500ml warm water
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 tbsp starter culture (from previous batch) or 1 tbsp plain yogurt

Instructions:
1. Mix sorghum flour with warm water, salt, and starter culture in a large bowl.
2. Cover with a clean cloth and let ferment at room temperature for 12-24 hours.
3. The batter should be thin and slightly bubbly with a sour smell when ready.
4. Heat a flat non-stick pan over medium heat.
5. Pour a small ladle of batter onto the pan and quickly tilt to spread thinly in a circular motion.
6. Cook for about 1-2 minutes until the top is dry and edges start to lift.
7. Remove from pan without flipping (traditionally cooked only on one side).
8. Stack the kisra on a clean cloth as they cook.
9. Serve with stews or dips.
10. Save some batter as starter culture for your next batch.

food_items.name: Meat from tiblica
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1kg beef or lamb, cut into cubes
- 3 tbsp oil
- 2 onions, finely chopped
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tbsp ginger, minced
- 2 tomatoes, chopped
- 1 hot pepper, chopped (optional)
- 1 tsp cumin
- 1 tsp coriander
- 1/2 tsp turmeric
- 1/2 tsp black pepper
- Salt to taste
- 1 cup water or broth
- Fresh cilantro for garnish

Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a tiblica (traditional clay pot) or heavy pot over medium heat.
2. Add onions and sauté until soft and translucent.
3. Add garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
4. Add meat and brown on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Add tomatoes, hot pepper, cumin, coriander, turmeric, black pepper, and salt.
6. Stir well to combine and cook for 5 minutes.
7. Add water or broth, cover, and simmer on low heat for 1.5-2 hours until meat is tender.
8. Uncover and reduce sauce if needed.
9. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.
10. Traditionally served with kisra or bread.

food_items.name: /g/1hc0hhj4r
food_items.recipe: N/A

food_items.name: Yufka
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 500g all-purpose flour
- 1 tsp salt
- 250ml warm water
- 2 tbsp olive oil
- Extra flour for dusting

Instructions:
1. Mix flour and salt in a large bowl.
2. Make a well in the center, add water and oil.
3. Mix with hands until dough forms, then knead for 10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
4. Divide dough into 8 equal balls.
5. Cover with a damp cloth and rest for 30 minutes.
6. Dust work surface with flour.
7. Take one ball and roll it out with a thin rolling pin, turning frequently to maintain circular shape.
8. Continue rolling until dough is paper-thin (you should be able to see through it).
9. Heat a large, flat pan or griddle over medium-high heat.
10. Cook each yufka for 30-60 seconds per side until lightly browned with spots.
11. Stack cooked yufka between clean kitchen towels to keep soft and prevent drying.
12. Can be used immediately for wraps or dried for later use.
13. To store, let cool completely and keep in airtight container.

food_items.name: Pisarei e faśö
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- For the pisarei (dumplings):
  - 300g bread flour
  - 100g breadcrumbs
  - 200ml warm water
  - 1 tsp salt
- For the sauce:
  - 250g dried borlotti beans, soaked overnight
  - 100g pancetta or bacon, diced
  - 1 onion, finely chopped
  - 1 carrot, finely chopped
  - 1 celery stalk, finely chopped
  - 2 cloves garlic, minced
  - 400g tomato passata
  - 1 bay leaf
  - Salt and pepper to taste
  - 2 tbsp olive oil
  - Grated Parmigiano-Reggiano for serving

Instructions:
1. For the beans: Drain soaked beans and place in a pot with fresh water. Bring to a boil, then simmer for about 1 hour until tender. Drain and set aside.
2. For the sauce: Heat olive oil in a large pot. Add pancetta and cook until crispy.
3. Add onion, carrot, celery, and garlic. Sauté until vegetables are soft.
4. Add tomato passata, bay leaf, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15 minutes.
5. Add cooked beans and simmer for another 15 minutes.
6. For the pisarei: Mix flour, breadcrumbs, and salt in a bowl. Gradually add warm water, kneading until a firm dough forms.
7. Let dough rest for 30 minutes, covered with a cloth.
8. Roll dough into thin ropes about 1cm thick.
9. Cut into small pieces and press each piece with your thumb to create a concave shape.
10. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook pisarei until they float to the surface, about 2-3 minutes.
11. Drain and add to the bean sauce. Stir gently to combine.
12. Serve hot with grated Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese.

food_items.name: /g/1pznmr_ch
food_items.recipe: N/A

food_items.name: Pampushka
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- For the dough:
  - 500g all-purpose flour
  - 7g active dry yeast
  - 250ml warm water
  - 1 tbsp sugar
  - 1 tsp salt
  - 2 tbsp vegetable oil
- For the garlic topping:
  - 4 cloves garlic, minced
  - 3 tbsp fresh dill, chopped
  - 3 tbsp vegetable oil
  - 1/2 tsp salt

Instructions:
1. In a small bowl, dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water. Let stand for 10 minutes until foamy.
2. In a large bowl, mix flour and salt. Add yeast mixture and oil. Knead until a soft, elastic dough forms (about 10 minutes).
3. Place dough in an oiled bowl, cover with a damp cloth, and let rise in a warm place for 1-1.5 hours, until doubled in size.
4. Punch down dough and divide into 12 equal pieces. Shape each piece into a ball.
5. Place balls on a greased baking sheet, leaving space between them.
6. Cover and let rise for another 30 minutes until puffy.
7. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
8. Bake for 20-25 minutes until golden brown.
9. While baking, prepare garlic topping: mix minced garlic, chopped dill, oil, and salt in a small bowl.
10. As soon as the pampushky come out of the oven, brush them with the garlic mixture.
11. Let cool slightly before serving.
12. Traditionally served with borscht.

food_items.name: Makowiec
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- For the dough:
  - 500g all-purpose flour
  - 40g fresh yeast or 14g dry yeast
  - 100g sugar
  - 100g butter, melted
  - 2 eggs
  - 250ml warm milk
  - 1 tsp vanilla extract
  - Pinch of salt
- For the poppy seed filling:
  - 400g poppy seeds
  - 150g sugar
  - 100g raisins
  - 100g mixed candied fruit, diced
  - 50g almonds, chopped
  - 100g butter
  - 2 eggs, separated
  - 2 tbsp honey
  - 1 tsp almond extract
- For the glaze:
  - 1 cup powdered sugar
  - 2-3 tbsp lemon juice

Instructions:
1. For the filling: Grind poppy seeds in a food processor or special grinder.
2. In a saucepan, melt butter. Add ground poppy seeds and cook for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.
3. Add sugar, honey, raisins, candied fruit, and almonds. Cook for another 5 minutes. Let cool.
4. Mix in egg yolks and almond extract.
5. Beat egg whites until stiff and fold into the mixture.
6. For the dough: Dissolve yeast in warm milk with 1 tbsp sugar. Let stand for 10 minutes until foamy.
7. In a large bowl, combine flour, remaining sugar, and salt.
8. Add yeast mixture, eggs, melted butter, and vanilla. Mix to form a soft dough.
9. Knead on a floured surface for 10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
10. Place in an oiled bowl, cover, and let rise for 1-2 hours until doubled.
11. Punch down dough and roll out on a floured surface into a rectangle about 1/4 inch thick.
12. Spread poppy seed filling evenly over dough, leaving 1-inch border.
13. Roll up tightly from the long side and place on a baking sheet, seam side down.
14. Cover and let rise for another 30 minutes.
15. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
16. Bake for 40-45 minutes until golden brown.
17. For the glaze: Mix powdered sugar with lemon juice until smooth.
18. Drizzle glaze over cooled cake.
19. Let glaze set before slicing.

food_items.name: Saleeg
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 2 cups short-grain rice
- 1 whole chicken (about 1.5kg)
- 2 onions, 1 whole and 1 chopped
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 cinnamon stick
- 4 cardamom pods
- 2 bay leaves
- 1 tsp black peppercorns
- 1 tsp salt
- 4 cups chicken broth
- 1 cup milk
- 1/2 cup heavy cream
- 2 tbsp ghee or butter
- For serving:
  - 2 tbsp ghee
  - 1/2 tsp black pepper
  - 1/2 tsp cumin powder
  - 1/4 tsp cardamom powder

Instructions:
1. Clean chicken and place in a large pot with whole onion, cinnamon stick, cardamom pods, bay leaves, peppercorns, and salt.
2. Cover with water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 45 minutes until chicken is tender.
3. Remove chicken from broth. Let cool slightly, then debone and shred the meat. Set aside.
4. Strain the broth and measure 4 cups for the rice.
5. In a separate pot, heat 2 tbsp ghee and sauté chopped onion and garlic until soft.
6. Add rice and stir to coat with ghee.
7. Add the 4 cups of chicken broth and bring to a boil.
8. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes.
9. Add milk and cream. Stir gently and continue cooking on low heat for another 15-20 minutes until rice is creamy and tender.
10. In a small pan, heat 2 tbsp ghee and add black pepper, cumin, and cardamom. Heat until fragrant.
11. To serve, place rice in a serving dish, top with shredded chicken, and drizzle with spiced ghee.
12. Traditionally served with duggus (tomato sauce) on the side.

food_items.name: /m/0100fwt6
food_items.recipe: N/A

food_items.name: Jókai bean soup
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 500g dried pinto or cranberry beans, soaked overnight
- 300g smoked ham hock
- 150g smoked sausage, sliced
- 100g bacon, diced
- 2 onions, finely chopped
- 2 carrots, diced
- 2 parsley roots, diced
- 1 celery root, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 bay leaf
- 1 tsp dried marjoram
- 1 tsp black pepper
- Salt to taste
- 2 tbsp lard or vegetable oil
- 2 tbsp flour
- 2 tbsp paprika
- 200ml sour cream
- Fresh parsley for garnish

Instructions:
1. Drain the soaked beans and place in a large pot with ham hock. Cover with water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour.
2. In a separate pan, heat lard or oil and sauté bacon until crispy.
3. Add onions and sauté until translucent.
4. Add carrots, parsley roots, and celery root. Cook for 5 minutes.
5. Add garlic, bay leaf, marjoram, and black pepper. Cook for 1 minute.
6. Add vegetable mixture to the beans and ham. Continue simmering for 30 minutes.
7. Remove ham hock, cut meat off the bone, dice, and return to soup.
8. Add sliced sausage and simmer for another 15 minutes.
9. In a small bowl, mix flour with a little water to make a smooth paste.
10. Stir paste into soup to thicken slightly. Simmer for 5 minutes.
11. Remove from heat. Stir in paprika.
12. In a separate bowl, mix sour cream with a ladleful of hot soup, then stir back into the pot.
13. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
14. Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley and extra sour cream on top.

food_items.name: Bookbinder soup
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 200g snapper or other white fish fillets
- 100g crab meat
- 2 tbsp butter
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 1 celery stalk, finely chopped
- 2 tbsp flour
- 500ml fish stock
- 250ml clam juice
- 2 tbsp tomato paste
- 1/2 tsp Worcestershire sauce
- 1/4 tsp cayenne pepper
- 2 tbsp dry sherry
- 250ml cream
- Salt and pepper to taste
- 2 tbsp fresh parsley, chopped
- Lemon wedges for serving

Instructions:
1. Cut fish into small cubes and set aside with crab meat.
2. In a large pot, melt butter over medium heat.
3. Add onion and celery. Sauté until soft but not browned, about 5 minutes.
4. Sprinkle flour over vegetables and stir to combine. Cook for 2 minutes.
5. Gradually whisk in fish stock and clam juice to avoid lumps.
6. Add tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, and cayenne pepper. Stir to combine.
7. Bring to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
8. Add fish cubes and simmer for 3 minutes.
9. Add crab meat and sherry. Simmer for another 2 minutes.
10. Stir in cream and heat through without boiling.
11. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
12. Ladle into serving bowls or traditional individual ceramic pots.
13. Garnish with chopped parsley and serve with lemon wedges.
14. Traditionally served with oyster crackers on the side.

food_items.name: Selat solo
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 500g beef tenderloin, cut into 1cm thick steaks
- 2 carrots, sliced diagonally
- 200g green beans, trimmed
- 2 potatoes, peeled and sliced
- 1 cucumber, thinly sliced
- 2 tomatoes, quartered
- 2 hard-boiled eggs, halved
- Lettuce leaves
- 2 tbsp butter

For the marinade:
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce
- 2 tbsp kecap manis (sweet soy sauce)
- 1 tbsp oyster sauce
- 1 tsp ground nutmeg
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1/2 tsp black pepper

For the sauce:
- 3 shallots, finely chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tbsp tomato paste
- 2 tbsp kecap manis
- 1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce
- 1 tsp mustard
- 1 tbsp brown sugar
- 1/2 tsp ground nutmeg
- 250ml water or beef broth
- 1 tbsp cornstarch dissolved in 2 tbsp water
- Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:
1. Mix all marinade ingredients in a bowl. Add beef steaks and marinate for at least 1 hour.
2. Boil carrots, green beans, and potatoes separately until tender but still firm. Drain and set aside.
3. For the sauce: Heat 1 tbsp butter in a saucepan. Sauté shallots and garlic until fragrant.
4. Add tomato paste, kecap manis, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, brown sugar, and nutmeg. Stir to combine.
5. Add water or broth and bring to a simmer. Cook for 5 minutes.
6. Add cornstarch mixture and stir until sauce thickens. Season with salt and pepper. Keep warm.
7. Heat remaining butter in a frying pan. Cook marinated beef steaks to desired doneness (about 2-3 minutes per side for medium-rare).
8. To serve: Arrange lettuce leaves on a plate. Place beef steak in the center.
9. Arrange vegetables, cucumber, tomato, and egg around the beef.
10. Pour warm sauce over the beef and vegetables.
11. Traditionally served with a side of pickles and rice.

food_items.name: Kutsinta
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 cup rice flour
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 3 cups water
- 1 tsp lye water (food grade)
- 1 tsp annatto powder (for color, optional)
- 1/2 tsp vanilla extract
- 1/4 tsp salt
- Cooking spray or oil for greasing molds
- Freshly grated coconut for topping

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine rice flour, all-purpose flour, brown sugar, and salt. Mix well.
2. Dissolve annatto powder in warm water if using, then add to the flour mixture.
3. Add remaining water, lye water, and vanilla extract. Stir until all ingredients are well combined and sugar is dissolved.
4. Let the batter rest for 30 minutes.
5. Lightly grease small molds or cups with cooking spray or oil.
6. Pour batter into molds, filling about 3/4 full.
7. Arrange molds in a steamer. Cover with a cloth before placing the lid to prevent water droplets from falling on the kutsinta.
8. Steam over medium heat for 30-40 minutes until kutsinta is firm and cooked through.
9. Remove from steamer and let cool slightly.
10. Run a knife around the edges and invert onto a serving plate.
11. Top with freshly grated coconut before serving.
12. Kutsinta should have a sticky, chewy texture when done properly.

food_items.name: Sago soup
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup small sago pearls (tapioca pearls)
- 5 cups water, divided
- 1 cup coconut milk
- 1/2 cup sugar (adjust to taste)
- 1/4 tsp salt
- 2 pandan leaves, knotted (optional)
- Additional flavorings (choose one):
  - 2 ripe mangoes, diced
  - 1 cup gulaman (agar) cubes
  - 1/2 cup sweet potato, diced and cooked
  - 1/2 cup jackfruit, sliced

Instructions:
1. Soak sago pearls in 2 cups cold water for 30 minutes. Drain.
2. Bring 3 cups water to a boil in a pot. Add soaked sago pearls.
3. Reduce heat to medium and simmer, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking.
4. Cook for about 15-20 minutes until the pearls are translucent with just a tiny white dot in the center.
5. Drain sago and rinse with cold water to stop cooking. Set aside.
6. In a clean pot, combine coconut milk, sugar, salt, and pandan leaves if using.
7. Bring to a gentle simmer over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Do not boil.
8. Add cooked sago pearls and simmer for another 5 minutes.
9. Add your choice of additional flavoring (mangoes, gulaman, sweet potato, or jackfruit).
10. Remove from heat and let cool slightly.
11. Serve warm or chilled in individual bowls.
12. For a cold version, refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

food_items.name: Vinegret
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 3 medium beets, cooked and diced
- 3 medium potatoes, cooked and diced
- 2 carrots, cooked and diced
- 1 cup sauerkraut, drained and chopped
- 3 pickles, diced
- 1 medium onion, finely chopped
- 1/2 cup green peas (fresh or frozen, thawed)
- 3 tbsp sunflower or olive oil
- 2 tbsp vinegar (white wine or apple cider)
- 1 tsp sugar
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Fresh dill for garnish

Instructions:
1. Cook beets separately from potatoes and carrots to prevent color bleeding. You can boil, bake, or steam them until tender but firm.
2. Cool all cooked vegetables completely before dicing into uniform small cubes (about 1/2 inch).
3. In a large bowl, combine diced beets, potatoes, carrots, sauerkraut, pickles, onion, and green peas.
4. In a small bowl, whisk together oil, vinegar, sugar, salt, and pepper to make the dressing.
5. Pour dressing over the vegetable mixture and gently toss to combine.
6. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight to allow flavors to meld.
7. Before serving, taste and adjust seasoning if necessary.
8. Garnish with fresh dill.
9. Serve cold as a salad or side dish.
10. Traditional variations may include adding beans, diced apples, or sardines.

food_items.name: Shrimp and grits
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- For the grits:
  - 1 cup stone-ground grits
  - 4 cups chicken broth
  - 1/2 cup heavy cream
  - 2 tbsp butter
  - 1 cup sharp cheddar cheese, grated
  - Salt and pepper to taste
- For the shrimp:
  - 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
  - 6 slices bacon, diced
  - 1 small onion, diced
  - 1 bell pepper, diced
  - 2 cloves garlic, minced
  - 1/2 cup scallions, chopped
  - 2 tbsp all-purpose flour
  - 1 cup chicken broth
  - 2 tbsp fresh lemon juice
  - 1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce
  - 1/2 tsp cayenne pepper (adjust to taste)
  - Hot sauce to taste
  - 2 tbsp fresh parsley, chopped
  - Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:
1. For the grits: In a large saucepan, bring chicken broth to a boil. Slowly whisk in grits.
2. Reduce heat to low and cover. Simmer for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until thick and creamy.
3. Stir in cream, butter, and cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Keep warm.
4. For the shrimp: In a large skillet, cook bacon until crispy. Remove bacon, leaving fat in the pan.
5. Add onion and bell pepper to the skillet. Sauté until soft, about 5 minutes.
6. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute more.
7. Add shrimp and cook until just pink, about 2 minutes per side. Remove shrimp and set aside.
8. Sprinkle flour over the vegetables and stir to combine. Cook for 1 minute.
9. Gradually add chicken broth, stirring constantly. Bring to a simmer.
10. Add lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, cayenne pepper, and hot sauce. Cook until sauce thickens, about 5 minutes.
11. Return shrimp and bacon to the skillet. Stir in most of the scallions and parsley, reserving some for garnish.
12. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
13. Serve shrimp and sauce over warm grits.
14. Garnish with remaining scallions and parsley.

food_items.name: Sirop de Liège
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 2kg apples (mix of sweet and tart varieties)
- 1kg pears (ripe but firm)
- 500g dates, pitted and chopped
- 400g sugar
- Juice of 1 lemon

Instructions:
1. Wash, core, and roughly chop the apples and pears. Do not peel them as the peels contain pectin needed for thickening.
2. Place fruit in a large, heavy-bottomed pot and add just enough water to prevent sticking (about 1/2 cup).
3. Bring to a simmer over medium heat and cook until fruits are soft, about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. Add chopped dates and continue to simmer for another 15 minutes until dates are soft.
5. Press the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve or food mill to remove peels and seeds.
6. Return the smooth puree to a clean pot. Add sugar and lemon juice.
7. Cook over low heat, stirring frequently to prevent burning, for about 1.5-2 hours until mixture is very thick and dark brown.
8. To test consistency, place a small amount on a cold plate. It should not spread much and form a thick, jam-like texture.
9. While still hot, carefully pour into sterilized jars and seal.
10. Once opened, store in the refrigerator for up to 3 months.
11. Traditionally served on bread, with cheese, or as a condiment for meat dishes.

food_items.name: Woku
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1kg chicken pieces or fish fillets
- 2 lemongrass stalks, bruised and tied in knots
- 5 kaffir lime leaves
- 2 pandan leaves, tied in knots (optional)
- 2 tomatoes, diced
- 1 lime, juiced
- 500ml water or chicken broth
- 2 tbsp vegetable oil
- Salt to taste
- Fresh basil leaves for garnish

For the spice paste:
- 10 shallots, peeled
- 6 cloves garlic
- 10 red chilies (adjust to taste)
- 5 bird's eye chilies (optional for extra heat)
- 3cm galangal, peeled
- 3cm ginger, peeled
- 5 candlenuts or macadamia nuts
- 1 tsp turmeric powder
- 1 tbsp coriander seeds, toasted and ground

Instructions:
1. For the spice paste: Blend all ingredients in a food processor until smooth, adding a little oil if needed to help blending.
2. Heat oil in a large pot or wok. Sauté spice paste over medium heat until fragrant and oil separates, about 7-10 minutes.
3. Add lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and pandan leaves. Stir for 1 minute.
4. Add chicken or fish and stir to coat with the spice mixture. Cook for 5 minutes, turning occasionally.
5. Add diced tomatoes and water or broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to simmer.
6. For chicken: Cook uncovered for 30-40 minutes until tender and sauce thickens.
7. For fish: Cook for 10-15 minutes until fish is cooked through.
8. Add lime juice and salt to taste.
9. Garnish with fresh basil leaves before serving.
10. Traditionally served with steamed rice or ketupat (rice cakes).

food_items.name: Muhallebi
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 4 cups milk
- 1/2 cup rice flour (or corn starch)
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 tsp rose water or orange blossom water
- 1/4 cup ground pistachios for garnish
- 1 tbsp dried rose petals for garnish (optional)
- Ground cinnamon for garnish

Instructions:
1. In a small bowl, mix rice flour with 1 cup of cold milk until completely dissolved and no lumps remain.
2. In a heavy-bottomed saucepan, heat the remaining 3 cups of milk and sugar over medium heat, stirring until sugar dissolves.
3. Just before the milk comes to a boil, gradually pour in the rice flour mixture while constantly whisking.
4. Continue to stir continuously to prevent lumps from forming.
5. Reduce heat to low and cook for about 10-15 minutes, stirring frequently, until the mixture thickens to a pudding-like consistency and coats the back of a spoon.
6. Remove from heat and stir in rose water or orange blossom water.
7. Pour the pudding into individual serving dishes or one large dish.
8. Let cool to room temperature, then refrigerate for at least 2 hours until set.
9. Before serving, garnish with ground pistachios, a sprinkle of cinnamon, and dried rose petals if using.
10. Traditionally served cold as a dessert.
11. Variations include topping with fruit compote, honey, or nuts.

food_items.name: Gepuk
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1kg beef flank or brisket, cut into large pieces
- 10 shallots, peeled
- 6 cloves garlic, peeled
- 3 candlenuts or macadamia nuts
- 2cm galangal, peeled
- 2cm ginger, peeled
- 1 tbsp coriander seeds, toasted and ground
- 1 tsp cumin seeds, toasted and ground
- 2 tbsp tamarind paste mixed with 1/4 cup water
- 4 tbsp palm sugar or brown sugar
- 2 bay leaves
- 3 kaffir lime leaves
- 2 cups coconut water or regular water
- 2 cups coconut milk
- Salt to taste
- Oil for frying
- Fresh chilies and lime for serving

Instructions:
1. In a food processor, blend shallots, garlic, candlenuts, galangal, and ginger into a smooth paste.
2. In a large pot, combine spice paste, coriander, cumin, tamarind liquid, palm sugar, bay leaves, and kaffir lime leaves.
3. Add beef pieces and mix well to coat with spices.
4. Pour in coconut water and coconut milk. Add salt to taste.
5. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Simmer uncovered for about 2 hours, stirring occasionally, until meat is very tender and liquid has reduced significantly.
6. Remove beef from the sauce and allow to cool slightly.
7. Place beef between two cutting boards or use a meat mallet to flatten each piece to about 1/2 inch thickness.
8. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.
9. Fry the flattened beef pieces until crispy and golden brown on the outside, about 2-3 minutes per side.
10. Drain on paper towels.
11. Reduce the remaining sauce until thick, then pour over the fried beef or serve on the side.
12. Serve with steamed rice, fresh chilies, and lime wedges.

food_items.name: Fouée
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 500g all-purpose flour
- 7g active dry yeast
- 300ml warm water
- 10g salt
- 1 tbsp olive oil, plus extra for brushing

Traditional fillings (choose as desired):
- Salted butter
- Rillettes
- Goat cheese
- Mushroom duxelles
- Mogettes (white beans)

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water and let stand for 5-10 minutes until foamy.
2. Add flour, salt, and olive oil. Mix to form a dough.
3. Knead on a floured surface for about 10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
4. Place dough in an oiled bowl, cover with a damp cloth, and let rise in a warm place for 1-1.5 hours, until doubled in size.
5. Preheat oven to its maximum temperature (ideally 500°F/260°C or higher) with a pizza stone or heavy baking sheet inside.
6. Punch down the dough and divide into 12 equal pieces.
7. Shape each piece into a ball, then flatten into a disc about 4-5 inches in diameter and 1/4 inch thick.
8. Place 2-3 discs at a time on the preheated stone or baking sheet.
9. Bake for 2-3 minutes until they puff up like balloons and begin to brown slightly.
10. Remove from oven and immediately split open while still hot.
11. Fill with your choice of traditional fillings.
12. Serve immediately while still warm.
13. Continue with remaining dough balls.
14. Traditionally baked in a wood-fired oven in the Loire Valley of France.

food_items.name: Octopus
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 whole octopus (about 2kg), cleaned
- 1 onion, quartered
- 2 bay leaves
- 4 cloves garlic, crushed
- 1 lemon, halved
- 1 tbsp black peppercorns
- 1/4 cup white wine vinegar
- 2 tbsp olive oil
- Salt to taste
- Fresh parsley, chopped
- Lemon wedges for serving

Instructions:
1. Clean the octopus by removing the beak (in the center of the tentacles) and the internal organs from the head if not already cleaned.
2. Rinse thoroughly under cold water.
3. Optional tenderizing step: Freeze the octopus for 24 hours, then thaw before cooking.
4. In a large pot, bring water to a boil. Add onion, bay leaves, garlic, lemon halves, peppercorns, and vinegar.
5. Hold the octopus by the head and dip the tentacles into the boiling water 3 times (this helps them curl up nicely).
6. Submerge the entire octopus in the boiling water, reduce heat to a simmer.
7. Cook uncovered for 45-60 minutes, depending on size, until tender when pierced with a fork.
8. Turn off heat and let octopus cool in the cooking liquid for 30 minutes.
9. Remove octopus and pat dry with paper towels.
10. At this point, you can prepare the octopus in several ways:
   a. Grilled: Brush with olive oil and grill for 3-4 minutes per side
   b. Sautéed: Slice and sauté in olive oil with garlic
   c. Cold salad: Slice and toss with olive oil, lemon juice, and herbs
11. Season with salt, drizzle with olive oil, and sprinkle with chopped parsley.
12. Serve with lemon wedges.
13. Traditional accompaniments include potatoes, garlic aioli, or simple green salad.

food_items.name: Koba
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 500g glutinous rice flour
- 250g peanuts, roasted and roughly chopped
- 250g brown sugar or palm sugar
- 300ml coconut milk
- 1/2 tsp salt
- Banana leaves for wrapping

Instructions:
1. Prepare banana leaves by washing thoroughly and wiping dry. Cut into large rectangles (about 20x30cm). Heat briefly over a flame or hot surface until pliable.
2. In a large bowl, combine glutinous rice flour with salt.
3. Gradually add coconut milk while stirring to form a thick paste. The texture should be like a soft dough that holds its shape.
4. In another bowl, mix chopped peanuts with brown sugar.
5. Lay a banana leaf flat. Spread about 1/4 cup of the rice flour mixture evenly on the leaf, leaving a 2-inch border.
6. Sprinkle a generous layer of the peanut-sugar mixture over the rice flour layer.
7. Add another layer of rice flour mixture on top, sealing in the peanut-sugar filling.
8. Fold the banana leaf over to form a rectangle or roll into a cylinder. Secure with toothpicks or tie with kitchen string.
9. Repeat with remaining ingredients.
10. Arrange the packages in a steamer basket, not touching each other.
11. Steam over medium heat for about 45-60 minutes, until firm and cooked through.
12. Remove from steamer and let cool slightly.
13. Serve warm or at room temperature by unwrapping the banana leaf.
14. Traditionally served as a snack or dessert in Madagascar.

food_items.name: Bò lúc lắc
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 500g beef sirloin or tenderloin, cut into 1-inch cubes
- 2 tbsp oyster sauce
- 2 tbsp soy sauce
- 1 tbsp fish sauce
- 1 tbsp sugar
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tsp black pepper
- 2 tbsp vegetable oil
- 1 onion, cut into wedges
- 1 red bell pepper, cut into squares
- 1 green bell pepper, cut into squares
- 2 tbsp butter
- 2 tbsp cooking wine or rice wine
- Lettuce leaves
- 1 cucumber, sliced
- 1 tomato, sliced
- Fresh herbs (cilantro, mint, or basil)

For the dipping sauce:
- Juice of 1 lime
- 1 tsp black pepper
- 1/2 tsp salt

Instructions:
1. In a bowl, combine beef with oyster sauce, soy sauce, fish sauce, sugar, garlic, and black pepper. Marinate for at least 30 minutes, preferably 2 hours.
2. Prepare the dipping sauce by mixing lime juice, black pepper, and salt in a small bowl. Set aside.
3. Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat until smoking.
4. Drain beef from marinade (reserve marinade) and add to the hot wok. Stir-fry quickly for about 1 minute until seared on all sides but still rare inside. Remove and set aside.
5. In the same wok, add onion and bell peppers. Stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until slightly softened but still crisp.
6. Add butter and reserved marinade. Stir until butter melts and sauce bubbles.
7. Add cooking wine and return beef to the wok. Toss quickly to coat everything in the sauce, about 30 seconds. Do not overcook the beef.
8. Arrange lettuce leaves on a serving plate. Top with cucumber and tomato slices.
9. Spoon the beef and vegetable mixture over the lettuce bed.
10. Garnish with fresh herbs.
11. Serve immediately with the dipping sauce on the side.
12. Traditionally served with steamed rice.

food_items.name: Squid lū'au
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 500g fresh squid, cleaned and cut into 1-inch pieces
- 500g taro leaves (luau leaves), stems removed and chopped
- 1 can (400ml) coconut milk
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1-inch piece ginger, grated
- 2 tbsp Hawaiian sea salt (or regular sea salt)
- 1/2 tsp black pepper
- Optional: 2 ti leaves for wrapping

Instructions:
1. Clean taro leaves thoroughly. IMPORTANT: Taro leaves must be cooked properly as they contain calcium oxalate crystals which can cause irritation if not fully cooked.
2. In a large pot, bring water to a boil. Add taro leaves and cook for 30-40 minutes until very soft and no longer itchy.
3. Drain leaves well and transfer to a food processor. Pulse until smooth but still has some texture.
4. In a large pot, sauté onion, garlic, and ginger until soft and fragrant.
5. Add squid pieces and cook for 2-3 minutes until they begin to turn opaque.
6. Add the processed taro leaves, coconut milk, salt, and pepper.
7. Stir well and bring to a simmer. Cover and cook on low heat for about 30-40 minutes, stirring occasionally, until squid is tender and flavors have melded.
8. Taste and adjust seasoning if needed.
9. Traditional preparation: Line a baking dish with ti leaves, pour squid luau mixture inside, fold leaves over to cover, and bake at 350°F (175°C) for 30 minutes.
10. Modern serving: Simply serve in bowls with steamed rice on the side.
11. This dish is traditionally served at Hawaiian luaus and family gatherings.

food_items.name: Shrimp Louie
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 lb large shrimp, peeled, deveined, and cooked
- 1 head iceberg lettuce, chopped
- 4 hard-boiled eggs, quartered
- 2 tomatoes, cut into wedges
- 1 cucumber, sliced
- 1 avocado, sliced
- 1/4 cup black olives
- 1/4 cup green onions, chopped
- Lemon wedges for serving

For the Louie dressing:
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1/4 cup chili sauce or ketchup
- 2 tbsp sweet pickle relish
- 1 tbsp lemon juice
- 1 tsp Worcestershire sauce
- 1/4 tsp hot sauce (optional)
- Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:
1. Prepare the Louie dressing by whisking together mayonnaise, chili sauce, pickle relish, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, and hot sauce in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Refrigerate until ready to use.
2. Arrange chopped iceberg lettuce on a large serving platter or individual plates.
3. Arrange cooked shrimp in the center of the lettuce.
4. Arrange hard-boiled egg quarters, tomato wedges, cucumber slices, avocado slices, and olives around the shrimp.
5. Sprinkle chopped green onions over the salad.
6. Drizzle with some of the Louie dressing and serve the remaining dressing on the side.
7. Garnish with lemon wedges.
8. Serve chilled as a main course salad.
9. Traditionally, this San Francisco classic can also be made with crab meat instead of or in addition to shrimp.

food_items.name: Black pudding
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 500g pork blood (fresh or frozen and thawed)
- 250g pork fat, diced into small cubes
- 1 large onion, finely diced
- 150g oatmeal, toasted
- 150g barley, cooked
- 2 tsp salt
- 1 tsp black pepper
- 1 tsp allspice
- 1/2 tsp nutmeg
- 1/2 tsp dried marjoram
- 1/4 tsp dried mint
- Hog casings, rinsed and soaked

Instructions:
1. If using fresh pork blood, strain it through a fine sieve to remove any clots. If using frozen blood, thaw completely and stir well.
2. In a frying pan, cook the diced pork fat over medium heat until it begins to render and turn slightly golden. Add the diced onion and cook until soft and translucent. Let cool slightly.
3. In a large bowl, combine blood, cooled fat and onion mixture, toasted oatmeal, and cooked barley.
4. Add salt, pepper, allspice, nutmeg, marjoram, and mint. Mix thoroughly to combine all ingredients.
5. Prepare hog casings according to package directions, usually by rinsing and soaking in water.
6. Fill a sausage stuffer or large funnel with the blood mixture and stuff into the casings, tying off into 6-inch links.
7. In a large pot, bring water to a simmer (not boiling) at about 170°F (75°C).
8. Carefully place the sausages in the simmering water and cook for about 20 minutes, or until firm to the touch. Be careful not to boil as the casings may burst.
9. Remove from water and hang to cool, or place in ice water to cool quickly.
10. To serve: slice into rounds and fry in butter or oil until crispy on both sides.
11. Traditionally served as part of a full breakfast with eggs, bacon, toast, and beans, or used in various recipes.

food_items.name: Cherry kebab
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 500g ground lamb
- 1 onion, finely grated
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tbsp parsley, finely chopped
- 1 tbsp mint, finely chopped
- 1 tsp ground cumin
- 1 tsp ground coriander
- 1/2 tsp cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp allspice
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1/4 tsp black pepper
- 1 tbsp olive oil

For the cherry sauce:
- 500g fresh cherries, pitted (or frozen, thawed)
- 1 tbsp butter
- 1 small onion, finely diced
- 1 cinnamon stick
- 2 tbsp pomegranate molasses
- 1 tbsp honey
- 1 tbsp lemon juice
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Fresh mint leaves for garnish

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine ground lamb, grated onion, garlic, parsley, mint, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, allspice, salt, and pepper. Mix well with your hands until fully incorporated.
2. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to allow flavors to meld.
3. Divide mixture into 8 portions and shape each around a metal skewer into an elongated sausage shape about 12cm long.
4. Brush kebabs with olive oil.
5. Preheat grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
6. Grill kebabs for about 4-5 minutes per side, turning occasionally, until cooked through but still juicy.
7. For the cherry sauce: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add diced onion and cook until soft.
8. Add pitted cherries and cinnamon stick. Cook for 5 minutes until cherries start to break down.
9. Add pomegranate molasses, honey, and lemon juice. Simmer for about 10-15 minutes until sauce thickens slightly.
10. Remove cinnamon stick and season with salt and pepper to taste.
11. Serve kebabs on a bed of rice or bulgur, with cherry sauce spooned over the top.
12. Garnish with fresh mint leaves.
13. This dish originates from Middle Eastern and Caucasian cuisine, particularly Azerbaijan.

food_items.name: Pitsi-pitsî
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 300g dried black-eyed peas
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 3 tbsp palm oil or vegetable oil
- 2 tomatoes, diced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1-inch piece ginger, grated
- 2 tbsp peanut butter
- 1 chili pepper, chopped (adjust to taste)
- 1 bay leaf
- 1 tsp thyme
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Fresh parsley or cilantro for garnish

Instructions:
1. Soak black-eyed peas in water overnight. Drain and rinse.
2. In a large pot, bring 6 cups of water to a boil. Add soaked black-eyed peas and cook for about 30-40 minutes until tender but not mushy. Drain and set aside.
3. Heat palm oil or vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat.
4. Add onions and sauté until translucent, about 5 minutes.
5. Add garlic, ginger, and chili pepper. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
6. Add diced tomatoes, bell pepper, bay leaf, and thyme. Cook for 5-7 minutes until vegetables are soft.
7. Stir in peanut butter until well incorporated.
8. Add cooked black-eyed peas and stir gently to combine with the sauce.
9. Add a little water if the mixture seems too dry.
10. Simmer on low heat for 15-20 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
11. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
12. Remove bay leaf before serving.
13. Garnish with chopped parsley or cilantro.
14. Serve hot as a main dish or side, traditionally accompanied by rice or plantains.
15. This dish originates from Madagascar and other parts of East Africa.

food_items.name: Sabich salad
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 2 large eggplants
- 4 hard-boiled eggs, quartered
- 3 tomatoes, diced
- 1 cucumber, diced
- 1 red onion, thinly sliced
- 1/2 cup parsley, chopped
- 1/2 cup mint, chopped
- 1 cup cooked chickpeas
- 1/4 cup tahini sauce
- 2 tbsp lemon juice
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/4 cup olive oil
- 1 tsp cumin
- Salt and pepper to taste
- 2 tbsp amba sauce (mango pickle condiment)
- 2 tbsp zhug (spicy herb sauce), optional

Instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. Slice eggplants into 1/2-inch rounds. Brush with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
3. Roast eggplant on baking sheets for 25-30 minutes, flipping halfway, until golden brown and tender. Let cool and cut into cubes.
4. In a small bowl, whisk together tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic, 2 tbsp olive oil, and enough water to make a pourable sauce. Season with salt.
5. In a large bowl, combine roasted eggplant, tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, parsley, mint, and chickpeas.
6. Drizzle with remaining olive oil and sprinkle with cumin, salt, and pepper. Toss gently to combine.
7. Arrange salad on a serving platter or individual plates.
8. Place quartered eggs on top of the salad.
9. Drizzle with tahini sauce and amba sauce.
10. If using, add a small amount of zhug for heat.
11. Serve at room temperature as a complete meal or as part of a mezze spread.
12. This dish is a deconstructed version of the Israeli sabich sandwich, which originated with Iraqi Jewish immigrants.

food_items.name: Mie kocok
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 500g wheat noodles (yellow egg noodles)
- 300g beef shank
- 100g beef tendons (optional)
- 100g bean sprouts, blanched
- 2 tbsp cooking oil
- 5 shallots, thinly sliced
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1-inch piece ginger, bruised
- 3 green onions, sliced, separate white and green parts
- 1 lemongrass stalk, bruised and tied in a knot
- 4 kaffir lime leaves
- 2 tbsp beef bouillon powder
- 1 tsp white pepper
- Salt to taste
- 8 cups water

For toppings:
- Fried shallots
- Chopped celery leaves
- Lime wedges
- Sambal (chili paste)
- Sliced fresh chili
- Sweet soy sauce (kecap manis)

Instructions:
1. In a large pot, bring water to a boil. Add beef shank, tendons (if using), ginger, lemongrass, white parts of green onions, and kaffir lime leaves.
2. Reduce heat and simmer for 2-3 hours until meat is very tender. Skim off any foam that rises to the surface.
3. Remove meat and tendons from broth. Let cool, then slice thinly or shred. Keep broth simmering.
4. In a separate pan, heat oil and sauté shallots and garlic until fragrant and golden.
5. Add sautéed shallots and garlic to the broth. Season with beef bouillon powder, white pepper, and salt to taste.
6. Cook noodles according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and rinse with cold water.
7. To serve: Place noodles in a bowl, top with bean sprouts, sliced beef and tendons.
8. Ladle hot broth over the noodles.
9. Garnish with fried shallots, green parts of green onions, celery leaves, and sliced fresh chili.
10. Serve with lime wedges, sambal, and sweet soy sauce on the side.
11. This dish originates from Bandung, West Java in Indonesia and is popular street food.

food_items.name: Maraca pie
food_items.recipe: Caribbean spiced meat pie, often filled with minced beef or chicken.

food_items.name: Banga
food_items.recipe: Nigerian palm nut soup, typically served with fish or meat.

food_items.name: Baccalà alla lucana
food_items.recipe: Italian salted cod dish from Basilicata, cooked with peppers and potatoes.

food_items.name: Nasi tumpang
food_items.recipe: Malaysian layered rice dish with curries, wrapped in banana leaves.

food_items.name: Gratin dauphinois
food_items.recipe: French potato gratin baked with cream and garlic.

food_items.name: Arroz chaufa
food_items.recipe: Peruvian-Chinese fried rice with soy sauce, eggs, and meat.

food_items.name: Kuih
food_items.recipe: Southeast Asian bite-sized snacks made from rice flour and coconut, often colorful and sweet.

food_items.name: Ayam goreng
food_items.recipe: Indonesian fried chicken marinated in turmeric and other spices.

food_items.name: Chongos zamoranos
food_items.recipe: Mexican dessert of curdled milk in sweet syrup, flavored with cinnamon.

food_items.name: /m/011c708
food_items.recipe: N/A

food_items.name: Mămăligă
food_items.recipe: Romanian polenta, often served with cheese or sour cream.

food_items.name: Candied almonds
food_items.recipe: Almonds coated in caramelized sugar, often sold at fairs.

food_items.name: Lasagne
food_items.recipe: Italian layered pasta dish with meat, cheese, and tomato sauce.

food_items.name: Pecel Lele
food_items.recipe: Indonesian fried catfish served with sambal and rice.

food_items.name: Lettuce soup
food_items.recipe: Light soup made from lettuce, stock, and cream, often garnished with herbs.

food_items.name: Acquacotta
food_items.recipe: Italian peasant soup with vegetables, bread, and poached eggs.

food_items.name: Pork blood soup
food_items.recipe: Filipino soup (dinuguan) made with pork blood, vinegar, and chili.

food_items.name: /m/011sq8kg
food_items.recipe: N/A

food_items.name: Buridda
food_items.recipe: Italian seafood stew with tomatoes, garlic, and white wine.

food_items.name: Maccu
food_items.recipe: Sicilian fava bean purée, often served with pasta or bread.

food_items.name: Turkey Devonshire

food_items.name: Cheeseburger
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1/4 pound (113g) ground beef
- 1 slice cheddar cheese
- 1 hamburger bun (top and bottom)
- 1 leaf romaine or iceberg lettuce
- 2 slices tomato (optional)
- 2 slices pickles
- 1 tbsp ketchup
- 1 tsp mustard
- Salt and pepper to taste
- 1/2 tbsp butter or oil for cooking

Instructions:
1. Shape ground beef into a round patty about 3/4 inch thick. Season both sides with salt and pepper.
2. Heat butter or oil in a skillet or on a grill over medium-high heat.
3. Cook the beef patty for about 3–4 minutes per side, or until it reaches your desired level of doneness.
4. Place the slice of cheddar cheese on the patty during the last minute of cooking and cover briefly to help it melt.
5. While the patty is cooking, lightly toast the hamburger bun halves on the skillet or grill until golden.
6. To assemble, place the cooked patty with melted cheese on the bottom bun.
7. Layer lettuce, tomato slices (if using), and pickles on top.
8. Add ketchup and mustard to taste.
9. Cover with the top bun and serve immediately while hot.
10. Serve with optional sides like fries, chips, or a salad for a complete meal.

food_items.name: Jelly Bean
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 50g sugar
- 1 tbsp water
- 1 tbsp corn syrup
- 1/4 tsp gelatin
- 1/4 tsp citric acid (optional)
- Natural or artificial flavoring (e.g. fruit extracts)
- Food coloring (as desired)
- Cornstarch (for dusting)

Instructions:
1. In a small saucepan, combine sugar, water, and corn syrup. Heat over medium heat until the sugar dissolves completely.
2. Stir in the gelatin and continue heating until the mixture becomes syrupy and slightly thickened.
3. Remove from heat and divide the mixture into small portions to flavor and color individually.
4. Add a drop or two of desired flavoring and coloring to each batch.
5. Spoon tiny drops of the mixture into a starch-dusted jelly bean mold or onto a parchment-lined tray.
6. Allow to set at room temperature for several hours or overnight until firm.
7. Roll the set jelly beans in a light cornstarch coating.
8. Optionally, apply a thin shellac or glaze coating to give them shine.
9. Store in an airtight container for up to 1 month.

Note: Calorie count is approximate per 4–5 jelly beans. Larger portions will contain more calories.

food_items.name: Apple Pie
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 6 medium apples (Granny Smith or Honeycrisp), peeled and sliced
- 3/4 cup (150g) sugar
- 1/4 cup (30g) brown sugar
- 2 tbsp all-purpose flour
- 1 tsp ground cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp ground nutmeg
- 1 tbsp lemon juice
- 2 tbsp butter
- 1 egg (for egg wash)
- 1 package (2 rolls) of pie crusts (or homemade)

Instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine sliced apples with sugars, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, and lemon juice. Toss to coat well.
3. Roll out one pie crust into a 9-inch pie dish. Press gently to fit.
4. Pour the apple mixture into the crust and dot with small pieces of butter.
5. Cover with the second crust. Seal the edges and cut a few slits on top for steam to escape. Optionally, use a lattice pattern.
6. Brush the top with beaten egg for a golden finish.
7. Bake for 45–50 minutes or until the crust is golden and the filling is bubbly.
8. Allow to cool for at least 2 hours before slicing.

Serving Suggestion: Enjoy warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.

food_items.name: Udon
food_items.recipe: Japanese thick wheat noodles served in broth or stir-fried.

food_items.name: Falafel
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 cup dried chickpeas (do not use canned)
- 1/2 large onion, roughly chopped (about 1 cup)
- 2 tbsp finely chopped fresh parsley
- 2 tbsp finely chopped fresh cilantro
- 1 tsp salt
- 1/2–1 tsp ground black pepper
- 4 cloves garlic
- 1 tsp ground cumin
- 1 tsp ground coriander
- 1/4 tsp cayenne pepper (optional)
- 1/2 tsp baking powder
- 4–6 tbsp flour (as needed)
- Oil for frying (e.g., vegetable or sunflower oil)

Instructions:
1. Place dried chickpeas in a bowl and cover with cold water. Soak overnight (12–24 hours), then drain completely.
2. In a food processor, add soaked chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, cilantro, salt, pepper, cumin, coriander, and cayenne. Process until a coarse meal forms.
3. Sprinkle in baking powder and 4 tbsp flour. Pulse again. Add more flour only if needed until mixture holds together.
4. Refrigerate mixture for 30–60 minutes.
5. Shape mixture into small balls or patties using wet hands or a falafel scoop.
6. Heat 2–3 inches of oil in a deep pan to 350°F (175°C). Fry falafel in batches for 3–4 minutes per side, until golden brown and crisp.
7. Drain on paper towels.

Serving Suggestion: Serve warm in pita bread with lettuce, tomato, cucumber, pickles, and tahini or yogurt sauce.

Note: Calorie count is per serving of ~4–5 falafel patties (without bread or sauce).

food_items.name: Agedashi dōfu
food_items.recipe: Japanese fried tofu served in a light dashi broth with grated daikon.

food_items.name: Dashi
food_items.recipe: Japanese stock made from kombu (kelp) and bonito flakes, used as a soup base.

food_items.name: Tortell
food_items.recipe: Catalan pastry filled with marzipan, traditionally eaten at Easter.

food_items.name: Omelette
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 3 large eggs
- 2 tbsp milk (optional, for fluffiness)
- Salt and pepper to taste
- 1 tbsp butter or oil
- 1/4 cup shredded cheese (e.g., cheddar or mozzarella)
- 1/4 cup diced vegetables (e.g., bell peppers, onions, spinach, mushrooms)
- 2 tbsp cooked ham or turkey (optional)

Instructions:
1. Crack eggs into a bowl, add milk (if using), and beat until well combined.
2. Stir in a pinch of salt and pepper.
3. Heat butter or oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
4. Add vegetables and sauté for 2–3 minutes until softened.
5. Pour egg mixture into the pan and swirl to cover the base.
6. Cook undisturbed for 1–2 minutes, then gently lift the edges with a spatula to let uncooked eggs flow underneath.
7. Sprinkle cheese and ham (if using) evenly over the surface.
8. Once mostly set, fold the omelette in half and cook for another 30 seconds.
9. Slide onto a plate and serve hot.

Note: Approximate calorie count includes eggs, vegetables, and cheese. Ham or other fillings may add 50–100 extra calories depending on quantity.

food_items.name: Crème brûlée
food_items.recipe: French dessert of rich custard topped with a layer of caramelized sugar.

food_items.name: Cucumber soup
food_items.recipe: Cold soup made from puréed cucumbers, yogurt, and herbs like dill.

food_items.name: French toast
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 2 slices of bread (white or brioche)
- 2 large eggs
- 1/4 cup milk
- 1/2 tsp vanilla extract
- 1/4 tsp cinnamon (optional)
- 1 tbsp butter
- Maple syrup, fresh fruit, or powdered sugar for serving

Instructions:
1. In a bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, vanilla, and cinnamon.
2. Heat a skillet over medium heat and melt the butter.
3. Dip each slice of bread into the egg mixture, coating both sides.
4. Place soaked bread in the skillet and cook for 2–3 minutes on each side until golden brown.
5. Serve warm with syrup, fruit, or powdered sugar as desired.

food_items.name: Tripe
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 500g beef tripe (cleaned and cut into strips)
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 tbsp oil
- 1 tsp paprika
- 1 tsp oregano
- 500ml beef or chicken broth
- 1 tomato, chopped
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Optional: chili flakes or peppers for spice

Instructions:
1. Rinse tripe thoroughly and boil in water for 1 hour to tenderize, then drain.
2. In a pot, heat oil over medium heat. Sauté onion and garlic until translucent.
3. Add paprika, oregano, salt, and pepper. Stir in chopped tomato.
4. Add tripe and broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 45 minutes.
5. Adjust seasoning. Serve hot with bread or rice. (Optional: garnish with cilantro or lime)

food_items.name: Pepperoni
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 500g ground pork
- 500g ground beef
- 1 tbsp paprika
- 1 tbsp cayenne pepper
- 1 tbsp fennel seeds
- 1 tbsp garlic powder
- 1 tsp curing salt (Prague powder #1)
- 1 tsp sugar
- 2 tbsp salt
- 1 tsp black pepper
- 1/4 cup red wine (optional)
- Hog casings for stuffing

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine all ingredients except casings and mix thoroughly.
2. Chill mixture overnight to let flavors develop.
3. Stuff into hog casings and twist into links.
4. Dry sausages at room temperature for 24 hours.
5. Hang in a cool, dry place for 4–6 weeks or refrigerate for semi-dry version.
6. Slice and use on pizza, sandwiches, or as a snack.

Note: Homemade pepperoni may vary in calories, but commercially sliced pepperoni has approx. 500 calories per 100g.

food_items.name: Salami
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 800g ground pork
- 200g beef fat or pork fat
- 2 tbsp salt
- 1 tbsp sugar
- 1 tbsp black pepper
- 1 tbsp garlic powder
- 1 tbsp fennel seeds
- 1 tsp pink curing salt (Prague powder #1)
- 2 tbsp red wine (optional)
- Natural or synthetic sausage casings

Instructions:
1. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and mix well.
2. Chill the mixture for a few hours.
3. Stuff into sausage casings and tie off into desired lengths.
4. Let dry at room temperature for 1 day.
5. Hang in a temperature- and humidity-controlled area (12–16°C, 70% humidity) for 4–8 weeks.
6. Slice thin and serve on charcuterie boards, in sandwiches, or with cheese.

Note: Commercial salami contains around 450 calories per 100g serving due to fat content.

food_items.name: Kimchi
food_items.recipe: Korean fermented vegetables (usually napa cabbage) with chili and garlic.

food_items.name: Knödel
food_items.recipe: Central European dumplings made from bread or potatoes, often served with gravy.

food_items.name: Takoyaki
food_items.recipe: Japanese ball-shaped snacks filled with diced octopus, fried and topped with sauce.

food_items.name: Halva
food_items.recipe: Middle Eastern sweet made from sesame paste (tahini) or semolina, flavored with nuts.

food_items.name: Pigs in a blanket
food_items.recipe: Small sausages wrapped in dough (e.g., crescent rolls) and baked.

food_items.name: Spanakopita
food_items.recipe: Greek spinach pie made with layers of phyllo dough, feta cheese, and herbs.

food_items.name: Pumpkin pie
food_items.recipe: Classic American dessert pie with spiced pumpkin custard filling.

food_items.name: Jambalaya
food_items.recipe: Louisiana Creole dish with rice, sausage, chicken, and seafood cooked in a seasoned broth.

food_items.name: Club sandwich
food_items.recipe: Double-decker sandwich with turkey, bacon, lettuce, tomato, and mayonnaise.

food_items.name: Churro
food_items.recipe: Spanish fried-dough pastry, dusted with sugar and cinnamon.

food_items.name: Turducken
food_items.recipe: American dish consisting of a deboned chicken stuffed into a deboned duck, which is then stuffed into a deboned turkey.

food_items.name: Welsh rarebit
food_items.recipe: British dish of melted cheese (often with ale or mustard) served over toasted bread.

food_items.name: Hot dog
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 hot dog sausage (beef or pork, approx. 90g)
- 1 hot dog bun
- 1 tsp yellow mustard
- 1 tsp ketchup
- 1 tbsp diced onions or relish (optional)
- Butter for bun toasting (optional)

Instructions:
1. Heat grill or skillet over medium heat.
2. Grill or steam the sausage until heated through and slightly browned (5–7 minutes).
3. Lightly butter and toast the inside of the bun if desired.
4. Place the sausage inside the bun.
5. Top with mustard, ketchup, onions, or relish as desired.
6. Serve hot.

Note: A standard hot dog with bun and condiments contains approximately 320 calories. Toppings may alter calorie count slightly.

food_items.name: Oyakodon
food_items.recipe: Japanese rice bowl dish with chicken, egg, and onions simmered in a soy-based broth.

food_items.name: Meatball
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 200g ground beef or pork
- 1/4 cup breadcrumbs
- 1 egg
- 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tbsp chopped parsley
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Olive oil for frying

Instructions:
1. In a bowl, combine ground meat, breadcrumbs, egg, cheese, garlic, parsley, salt, and pepper.
2. Mix until just combined, being careful not to overwork.
3. Form mixture into 1-inch balls.
4. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
5. Fry meatballs until browned on all sides and cooked through (10–12 minutes).
6. Optional: Simmer in tomato sauce for extra flavor.

Calories: Approx. 250 for 3–4 medium meatballs (depending on meat type and sauce).

food_items.name: Waldorf salad
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 apple, diced
- 1/2 cup celery, chopped
- 1/4 cup walnuts, chopped
- 2 tbsp mayonnaise or plain yogurt
- 1 tsp lemon juice
- Salt to taste

Instructions:
1. In a bowl, combine apples, celery, and walnuts.
2. In a separate bowl, mix mayonnaise (or yogurt) with lemon juice.
3. Pour dressing over the apple mixture and stir to coat.
4. Chill before serving.

Calories: Approx. 280 per serving with mayonnaise (slightly lower with yogurt).

food_items.name: Potato salad
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 3 medium potatoes, peeled and diced
- 1/4 cup mayonnaise
- 1 tsp mustard
- 2 tbsp chopped pickles or relish
- 2 tbsp chopped onions
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Optional: 1 boiled egg, chopped

Instructions:
1. Boil potatoes until tender (about 10–12 minutes), then drain and cool.
2. In a bowl, mix mayonnaise, mustard, pickles, onions, salt, and pepper.
3. Add cooled potatoes and mix until evenly coated.
4. Stir in chopped egg if desired.
5. Chill before serving.

Calories: Approx. 320 per 1-cup serving.

food_items.name: Satay
food_items.recipe: Southeast Asian skewered and grilled meat, served with peanut sauce.

food_items.name: Pemmican
food_items.recipe: Native American energy-dense food made from dried meat, fat, and berries.

food_items.name: Mämmi
food_items.recipe: Finnish Easter dessert made from rye flour and molasses, served cold with cream.

food_items.name: Fideuà
food_items.recipe: Spanish dish similar to paella but made with short noodles instead of rice.

food_items.name: Waffle
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 2 tbsp sugar
- 1 tbsp baking powder
- 1/4 tsp salt
- 1 1/4 cups milk
- 2 eggs
- 1/3 cup melted butter
- 1 tsp vanilla extract

Instructions:
1. Preheat waffle iron.
2. In a bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
3. In another bowl, whisk together milk, eggs, melted butter, and vanilla.
4. Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and stir until just combined (lumps are fine).
5. Grease waffle iron and pour batter into the iron.
6. Close and cook until golden brown (about 3-5 minutes).
7. Serve with syrup, butter, or fresh fruit.

Calories: Approx. 300 per waffle (depending on size and toppings).

food_items.name: Pancake
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 tbsp sugar
- 1 tbsp baking powder
- 1/4 tsp salt
- 1 egg
- 3/4 cup milk
- 2 tbsp melted butter
- 1 tsp vanilla extract

Instructions:
1. In a bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
2. In another bowl, whisk together egg, milk, melted butter, and vanilla.
3. Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and stir until just combined (don't overmix).
4. Heat a griddle or skillet over medium heat and lightly grease with butter or oil.
5. Pour 1/4 cup of batter for each pancake onto the skillet.
6. Cook until bubbles form on the surface and the edges are set, then flip and cook until golden brown.
7. Serve with syrup, butter, or fruit.

Calories: Approx. 250 per medium pancake (without toppings).

food_items.name: Quiche
food_items.recipe: French tart consisting of pastry crust filled with eggs, cream, and cheese plus meat, seafood, or vegetables.

food_items.name: Borscht
food_items.recipe: Eastern European soup made with beetroot as the main ingredient, often served with sour cream.

food_items.name: Bratwurst
food_items.recipe: German sausage made from pork, beef, or veal, typically grilled or fried.

food_items.name: Foie gras
food_items.recipe: French delicacy made from the liver of a duck or goose that has been specially fattened.

food_items.name: Burrito
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 large flour tortilla
- 200g cooked chicken, beef, or pork (your choice)
- 1/2 cup cooked rice
- 1/4 cup black beans or refried beans
- 1/4 cup shredded cheese
- 2 tbsp sour cream
- 2 tbsp salsa
- 1/4 avocado, sliced
- 1 tbsp chopped cilantro (optional)
- Lime wedges for serving

Instructions:
1. Warm the flour tortilla on a skillet or in the microwave until soft.
2. Layer the cooked rice, beans, meat, cheese, sour cream, salsa, and avocado in the center of the tortilla.
3. Fold the sides of the tortilla inward and then roll it tightly from one end to the other to form the burrito.
4. Serve with lime wedges and cilantro, if desired.

Calories: Approx. 500 per burrito (varies based on ingredients and portion size).

food_items.name: Goulash
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 500g beef stew meat, cut into cubes
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tbsp paprika
- 1 tbsp flour
- 1 can (400g) diced tomatoes
- 1 cup beef broth
- 2 carrots, chopped
- 2 potatoes, peeled and cubed
- 1 bell pepper, chopped
- 1 tbsp vegetable oil
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)

Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the beef cubes and brown on all sides.
2. Add onion and garlic, cooking until soft and fragrant.
3. Sprinkle paprika and flour over the beef and stir to coat evenly.
4. Add diced tomatoes, beef broth, carrots, potatoes, and bell pepper to the pot. Stir well.
5. Bring to a simmer, cover, and cook for 1-1.5 hours until meat is tender and vegetables are soft.
6. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve hot.

Calories: Approx. 380 per serving (depending on portion size).

food_items.name: Spotted dick
food_items.recipe: British steamed suet pudding containing dried fruit, often served with custard.

food_items.name: Coq au vin
food_items.recipe: French dish of chicken braised with wine, mushrooms, and garlic.

food_items.name: Ratatouille
food_items.recipe: French Provençal stewed vegetable dish, typically including eggplant, zucchini, and tomatoes.

food_items.name: Cornbread
food_items.recipe: Quick bread made with cornmeal, popular in the Southern United States.

food_items.name: Souvlaki
food_items.recipe: Greek fast food consisting of small pieces of meat and sometimes vegetables grilled on a skewer.

food_items.name: Chow mein
food_items.recipe: Chinese stir-fried noodles with vegetables and sometimes meat or tofu.

food_items.name: Roast beef
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1.5 kg beef roast (e.g., ribeye, sirloin, or round)
- 2 tbsp olive oil
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tbsp fresh rosemary, chopped
- 1 tbsp fresh thyme, chopped
- Salt and pepper to taste
- 1 cup beef broth
- 1/4 cup red wine (optional)

Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 220°C (425°F).
2. Rub the beef roast with olive oil, garlic, rosemary, thyme, salt, and pepper.
3. Place the roast on a rack in a roasting pan, fat side up.
4. Roast in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes to develop a crust.
5. Reduce the oven temperature to 180°C (350°F) and continue roasting for about 1.5 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 55-60°C (130-140°F) for medium-rare.
6. Let the roast rest for 10-15 minutes before slicing.
7. For gravy, place the pan drippings over medium heat, add beef broth and red wine, and simmer until thickened.

Calories: Approx. 350 per 3 oz serving.

food_items.name: Peking duck
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 whole duck (about 2-3 kg)
- 2 tbsp soy sauce
- 1 tbsp rice vinegar
- 1 tbsp hoisin sauce
- 1 tbsp honey
- 5-6 slices of ginger
- 2 scallions, chopped
- 12-16 thin pancakes (for serving)
- Hoisin sauce (for serving)
- Cucumber, julienned (for serving)

Instructions:
1. Rinse and pat the duck dry, then prick the skin all over with a fork to help render the fat.
2. Mix soy sauce, rice vinegar, hoisin sauce, and honey in a bowl. Rub the duck with the mixture.
3. Place ginger and scallions inside the duck cavity.
4. Hang the duck in a cool, dry place to dry for 4-6 hours (or use a hairdryer to dry the skin).
5. Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F). Roast the duck for 40-45 minutes, basting occasionally with the sauce.
6. Once the skin is crispy and golden brown, remove the duck and let it rest for 10 minutes.
7. Carve the duck, serving the skin and meat with pancakes, hoisin sauce, and cucumber.

Calories: Approx. 500 per 1/4 duck (without sides).

food_items.name: Fried chicken
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 4 chicken pieces (drumsticks or thighs)
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 1 tbsp hot sauce (optional)
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 tbsp paprika
- 1 tbsp garlic powder
- 1 tsp onion powder
- 1 tsp salt
- 1/2 tsp black pepper
- 1/2 tsp cayenne pepper
- Vegetable oil for frying

Instructions:
1. Marinate the chicken pieces in a mixture of buttermilk and hot sauce for at least 2 hours (or overnight).
2. In a shallow dish, mix the flour, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper.
3. Dredge each chicken piece in the flour mixture, pressing to coat evenly.
4. Heat oil in a deep fryer or large pan to 175°C (350°F). Fry the chicken for 12-15 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through (internal temperature should reach 75°C/165°F).
5. Remove the chicken and place it on paper towels to drain excess oil.
6. Serve hot with sides like mashed potatoes, coleslaw, or biscuits.

Calories: Approx. 400 per piece (depending on size and batter).

food_items.name: Tahini
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 cup sesame seeds (hulled)
- 2-3 tbsp olive oil (or vegetable oil)
- Salt to taste

Instructions:
1. Toast the sesame seeds in a dry pan over medium heat for 5-7 minutes, stirring frequently to avoid burning.
2. Allow the sesame seeds to cool slightly before transferring them to a food processor.
3. Add the olive oil and salt. Process until smooth and creamy, adding more oil if necessary to reach your desired consistency.
4. Taste and adjust salt or oil as needed.
5. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 month.

Calories: Approx. 89 calories per 2 tbsp serving.

food_items.name: Saltah
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 500g lamb or chicken, cut into chunks
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 tomatoes, chopped
- 2 tbsp vegetable oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tsp ground cumin
- 1 tsp ground coriander
- 1 tsp ground turmeric
- 1 tsp ground cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp black pepper
- 4 cups beef or chicken broth
- 2 tbsp tomato paste
- 2 tbsp fenugreek seeds
- 1-2 tbsp dried coriander
- 1 green chili (optional)
- Salt to taste

Instructions:
1. Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat.
2. Add the chopped onion and garlic, cooking until soft and fragrant.
3. Add the chopped tomatoes, cumin, coriander, turmeric, cinnamon, and black pepper. Stir and cook for about 5 minutes.
4. Add the meat chunks (lamb or chicken) and cook until browned on all sides.
5. Pour in the broth and add the tomato paste, salt, and dried coriander. Bring the stew to a boil, then reduce heat to a simmer.
6. Simmer for 1-2 hours, until the meat is tender and the stew has thickened.
7. In a separate small pan, toast the fenugreek seeds until they become aromatic (about 2 minutes), then mash them into a paste using a mortar and pestle or food processor.
8. Once the stew is done, stir in the fenugreek paste and allow it to simmer for another 10 minutes.
9. Optionally, add green chili for spice.
10. Serve the Saltah in bowls, topped with a dollop of the fenugreek froth, and enjoy!

Calories: Approx. 350 calories per serving.
