food_items.name: Shakshouka
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 2 tbsp olive oil
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 bell pepper, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 can (400g) crushed tomatoes
- 1 tbsp tomato paste
- 1 tsp ground cumin
- 1 tsp paprika
- 1/2 tsp ground chili or cayenne pepper (optional)
- 4-6 large eggs
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Fresh parsley or cilantro for garnish
- Crusty bread for serving

Instructions:
1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat.
2. Add the chopped onion and bell pepper, and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the minced garlic, cumin, paprika, and cayenne pepper (if using), and cook for another 1 minute.
4. Stir in the crushed tomatoes and tomato paste. Simmer for 10-15 minutes, until the sauce thickens slightly.
5. Make small wells in the sauce and crack the eggs into each well.
6. Cover the skillet and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until the egg whites are set but the yolks remain runny. (You can cook for longer if you prefer firmer yolks.)
7. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Garnish with fresh parsley or cilantro and serve with crusty bread.

Calories: Approx. 350 calories per serving (based on 2 eggs per serving).

food_items.name: Shawarma
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 500g boneless chicken thighs or beef strips
- 3 tbsp plain yogurt
- 2 tbsp lemon juice
- 2 tbsp olive oil
- 3 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 tsp ground cumin
- 1 tsp ground paprika
- 1/2 tsp ground turmeric
- 1/2 tsp ground cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp ground coriander
- Salt and pepper to taste

For serving:
- Pita bread or flatbread
- Sliced tomatoes, cucumbers, pickles
- Lettuce or cabbage
- Garlic sauce or tahini sauce

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, mix yogurt, lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, and all the spices.
2. Add chicken or beef to the marinade and coat well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
3. Heat a skillet or grill over medium-high heat. Cook the marinated meat for about 8–10 minutes until fully cooked and slightly charred.
4. Warm the pita bread and layer it with cooked meat, vegetables, and sauce.
5. Roll the pita into a wrap and serve hot.

Calories: Approx. 550 calories per shawarma wrap (with chicken, sauce, and vegetables).

food_items.name: Chicken nugget
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 500g ground chicken or finely chopped chicken breast
- 1/2 cup breadcrumbs
- 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese (optional)
- 1 egg
- 1 tsp garlic powder
- 1/2 tsp onion powder
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1/4 tsp black pepper
- 1/2 cup flour (for coating)
- 2 eggs, beaten (for coating)
- 1 cup breadcrumbs (for coating)
- Oil for frying or spray for baking

Instructions:
1. In a mixing bowl, combine chicken, breadcrumbs, Parmesan, egg, and seasonings. Mix well.
2. Form the mixture into small nugget shapes using your hands or a spoon.
3. Coat each nugget in flour, dip in beaten eggs, and roll in breadcrumbs.
4. Heat oil in a pan and fry nuggets in batches until golden brown and cooked through (about 3–4 minutes per side), or bake at 200°C (400°F) for 20 minutes, flipping halfway.
5. Drain excess oil on paper towels if fried. Serve with ketchup, mustard, or dipping sauce of choice.

Calories: Approximately 290 calories per 100g (varies slightly with method of preparation and coating thickness).

food_items.name: Cheesecake
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 200g digestive biscuits (or graham crackers)
- 100g unsalted butter, melted
- 600g cream cheese (room temperature)
- 150g granulated sugar
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- 3 large eggs
- 200ml sour cream
- 2 tbsp all-purpose flour
- Zest of 1 lemon (optional)

Instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 160°C (320°F). Line the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan with parchment paper.
2. Crush biscuits into fine crumbs and mix with melted butter. Press mixture into the bottom of the pan to form an even crust. Chill in the fridge while preparing the filling.
3. In a large bowl, beat cream cheese until smooth. Add sugar and vanilla, then mix in eggs one at a time.
4. Add sour cream, flour, and lemon zest (if using). Mix until well combined.
5. Pour the mixture over the chilled crust. Tap the pan gently to remove air bubbles.
6. Bake for 50–60 minutes, or until the center is almost set but still slightly jiggly.
7. Turn off the oven, leave the door slightly open, and let the cheesecake cool inside for 1 hour.
8. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours or overnight before serving.

Calories: Approximately 430 calories per slice (1/12 of a standard 9-inch cheesecake).

- 2 cups water

Instructions:

Calories: Approx. 600 per bowl.

food_items.name: Shahi paneer
food_items.recipe: Ingredients: Paneer, cream, tomatoes, cashews, garam masala. Instructions: Cook paneer in a creamy tomato-cashew sauce with spices. Calories: Approx. 500 per serving.

food_items.name: Fufu
food_items.recipe: Ingredients: Cassava, plantain, water. Instructions: Boil cassava and plantain, pound into a sticky dough. Calories: Approx. 300 per serving.

food_items.name: Pyttipanna
food_items.recipe: Ingredients: Potatoes, beef, sausage, onions, egg. Instructions: Fry diced ingredients together, top with a fried egg. Calories: Approx. 500 per serving.

food_items.name: Chicken sandwich
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 chicken breast
- 1 bun
- Lettuce, tomato
- 2 tbsp mayonnaise
- Flour, egg, breadcrumbs

Instructions:
1. Coat chicken in flour, egg, and breadcrumbs, fry until golden.
2. Toast bun, spread mayo, add chicken, lettuce, and tomato.
3. Serve hot.

Calories: Approx. 500 per sandwich.

food_items.name: Ghari
food_items.recipe: Ingredients: Flour, ghee, milk solids, sugar. Instructions: Fill dough with milk solids and sugar, fry, coat with ghee. Calories: Approx. 300 per piece.

food_items.name: Michigan salad
food_items.recipe: Ingredients: Lettuce, dried cherries, blue cheese, walnuts, vinaigrette. Instructions: Toss ingredients with vinaigrette. Calories: Approx. 300 per serving.

food_items.name: Cabinet pudding
food_items.recipe: Ingredients: Sponge cake, custard, dried fruit, cream. Instructions: Layer cake and fruit, pour custard over, steam, serve with cream. Calories: Approx. 350 per serving.

food_items.name: American fried rice
food_items.recipe: Ingredients: Rice, hot dogs, chicken, ketchup, raisins. Instructions: Fry rice with hot dogs, chicken, and ketchup, add raisins. Calories: Approx. 500 per serving.

food_items.name: Korovai
food_items.recipe: Ingredients: Flour, eggs, sugar, decorations. Instructions: Bake a decorative sweet bread for ceremonies. Calories: Approx. 300 per slice.

food_items.name: Churrasco
food_items.recipe: Ingredients: Beef, chimichurri, salt. Instructions: Grill beef, serve with chimichurri sauce. Calories: Approx. 600 per serving.

food_items.name: Pasulj
food_items.recipe: Ingredients: White beans, sausage, onions, paprika. Instructions: Simmer beans with sausage and spices. Calories: Approx. 400 per bowl.

food_items.name: Mitraillette
food_items.recipe: Ingredients: Baguette, fries, meat, sauce. Instructions: Fill baguette with fries, meat, and sauce. Calories: Approx. 800 per sandwich.

food_items.name: Salată de boeuf
food_items.recipe: Ingredients: Beef, potatoes, carrots, pickles, mayonnaise. Instructions: Mix diced ingredients with mayonnaise, chill. Calories: Approx. 400 per serving.

food_items.name: Rice pudding
food_items.recipe: Ingredients: Rice, milk, sugar, cinnamon. Instructions: Cook rice in sweetened milk, sprinkle with cinnamon. Calories: Approx. 300 per serving.

food_items.name: Rösti
food_items.recipe: Ingredients: Potatoes, butter, salt. Instructions: Grate potatoes, fry into a crispy pancake. Calories: Approx. 300 per serving.

food_items.name: Naryn
food_items.recipe: Ingredients: Horse meat, noodles, broth, onions. Instructions: Boil meat, serve with noodles and onion in broth. Calories: Approx. 400 per serving.

food_items.name: Kaldereta
food_items.recipe: Ingredients: Goat meat, tomato sauce, liver paste, potatoes, olives. Instructions: Simmer meat with vegetables and sauce. Calories: Approx. 500 per serving.

food_items.name: Makroudh
food_items.recipe: Mix semolina, flour, and butter to form a dough. Stuff with a date paste mixed with cinnamon and orange zest. Shape into diamonds, fry in oil until golden, then soak in honey syrup. Serve warm or at room temperature.

food_items.name: Kachumbari
food_items.recipe: Chop tomatoes, red onions, cucumber, and chili peppers. Mix with chopped cilantro, lime juice, and a pinch of salt. Toss well and serve as a fresh salad or side dish.

food_items.name: Tsukemono
food_items.recipe: Slice cucumbers, radishes, or cabbage thinly. Salt generously and let sit for 30 minutes. Rinse, then marinate in a mixture of rice vinegar, sugar, and soy sauce for a few hours. Serve as a pickle.

food_items.name: Cheese fries
food_items.recipe: Fry or bake potato fries until crispy. Melt cheddar cheese with a splash of milk to make a sauce. Pour over hot fries, optionally topping with bacon bits or green onions. Serve immediately.

food_items.name: Slatko
food_items.recipe: Simmer whole fruits like cherries or plums in a sugar-water syrup until soft and glossy. Add a splash of lemon juice. Cool and serve as a sweet preserve with coffee or bread.

food_items.name: Qatayef
food_items.recipe: Prepare small pancakes with a batter of flour, yeast, and water. Fill with a mixture of sweetened cheese or nuts. Fold into half-moons, seal edges, and fry until golden. Drizzle with sugar syrup.

food_items.name: Passatelli
food_items.recipe: Mix breadcrumbs, Parmesan cheese, eggs, and nutmeg to form a dough. Press through a ricer into boiling chicken broth. Cook until the noodles float, about 2-3 minutes. Serve hot.

food_items.name: Sweet potato soup
food_items.recipe: Boil diced sweet potatoes with onions and garlic in vegetable broth until soft. Blend until smooth, then stir in coconut milk and a pinch of cinnamon. Heat through and serve with crusty bread.

food_items.name: Shchi
food_items.recipe: Simmer shredded cabbage, carrots, potatoes, and onions in beef or vegetable broth. Add tomatoes and a bay leaf. Cook until vegetables are tender. Serve with sour cream and dill.

food_items.name: Kulfi
food_items.recipe: Simmer milk with sugar, cardamom, and saffron until thickened. Stir in chopped pistachios or almonds. Pour into molds, freeze for 6 hours, and serve as a creamy frozen dessert.

food_items.name: Dolma
food_items.recipe: Wrap a mixture of rice, vegetables, and ground meat in grape leaves. Place in a pot, cover with broth and lemon juice, and simmer for 45 minutes. Serve with yogurt.

food_items.name: Kai yang
food_items.recipe: Marinate chicken with garlic, lemongrass, fish sauce, and turmeric. Grill over charcoal until cooked through. Serve with sticky rice and a spicy dipping sauce.

food_items.name: Shark fin soup
food_items.recipe: Simmer chicken broth with dried shark fin, ginger, and scallions. Add cornstarch slurry to thicken. Season with soy sauce and serve hot. Note: Consider ethical alternatives due to conservation concerns.

food_items.name: Pozole
food_items.recipe: Cook hominy and pork in a broth with guajillo chiles, garlic, and oregano. Simmer until tender. Serve with shredded cabbage, radishes, lime, and tostadas.

food_items.name: Pakora
food_items.recipe: Mix chickpea flour, spices, and water to make a batter. Dip sliced vegetables like onions or potatoes in batter and deep-fry until golden. Serve with chutney.

food_items.name: Chantilly cake
food_items.recipe: Bake a vanilla sponge cake. Layer with whipped cream mixed with sugar and vanilla. Top with fresh berries and frost with more whipped cream. Chill before serving.

food_items.name: Krówki
food_items.recipe: Cook milk, sugar, and butter until caramelized. Pour into a tray, cool, and cut into small rectangles. Wrap in wax paper for chewy fudge-like candies.

food_items.name: Russian tea cake
food_items.recipe: Mix butter, powdered sugar, flour, and chopped nuts to form a dough. Roll into balls, bake at 350°F for 12 minutes, and roll in powdered sugar while warm.

food_items.name: Ox-tongue pastry
food_items.recipe: Layer puff pastry with a sugar glaze. Bake until golden and flaky. Cut into tongue-shaped pieces. Serve as a sweet, crispy treat.

food_items.name: Sachertorte
food_items.recipe: Bake a chocolate sponge cake. Spread with apricot jam, then cover with chocolate glaze. Serve with whipped cream for a rich dessert.

food_items.name: Palitaw
food_items.recipe: Mix glutinous rice flour with water to form a dough. Flatten into discs, boil until they float, then coat with grated coconut, sugar, and sesame seeds.

food_items.name: Jolpan
food_items.recipe: Combine puffed rice, yogurt, and jaggery or honey. Add fruits like banana or mango. Mix and serve as a light, sweet breakfast or snack.

food_items.name: Mantou
food_items.recipe: Knead flour, yeast, sugar, and water into a dough. Let rise, shape into buns, and steam for 15 minutes. Serve plain or with savory dishes.

food_items.name: Finger steaks
food_items.recipe: Cut beef into strips, coat in seasoned flour, dip in egg, then breadcrumbs. Deep-fry until golden. Serve with a dipping sauce like ranch.

food_items.name: Steak sandwich
food_items.recipe: Grill thinly sliced steak. Layer on a bun with sautéed onions, peppers, and melted cheese. Add lettuce, tomato, and mayonnaise. Serve hot.

food_items.name: Talo
food_items.recipe: Mix cornmeal, water, and salt to form a dough. Shape into flatbreads and cook on a hot griddle until golden. Serve with cheese or sausage.

food_items.name: Erkuai
food_items.recipe: Steam rice flour dough until firm. Slice thinly and stir-fry with vegetables, meat, and chili sauce. Serve as a chewy noodle dish.

food_items.name: Mixian
food_items.recipe: Cook rice noodles in boiling water. Serve in a broth with minced meat, peanuts, and chili oil, or stir-fry with vegetables and soy sauce.

food_items.name: St. Louis-style pizza
food_items.recipe: Spread a thin crust with sweet tomato sauce and Provel cheese. Add toppings like sausage or peppers. Bake at 425°F until crispy, then cut into squares.

food_items.name: Moambe
food_items.recipe: Cook chicken in a sauce of palm butter, tomatoes, onions, and chili. Simmer until tender. Serve with rice or fufu.

food_items.name: Upma
food_items.recipe: Roast semolina, then cook with sautéed onions, mustard seeds, curry leaves, and water. Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.

food_items.name: Panjiri
food_items.recipe: Roast wheat flour in ghee with sugar, nuts, and cardamom. Mix well and serve as a sweet, energy-rich snack.

food_items.name: Eggs Sardou
food_items.recipe: Poach eggs and place on artichoke hearts over creamed spinach. Top with hollandaise sauce and serve warm.

food_items.name: Shanghai fried noodles
food_items.recipe: Stir-fry thick noodles with pork, cabbage, and mushrooms in soy sauce and oyster sauce. Cook until noodles are crispy. Serve hot.

food_items.name: Quarkkäulchen
food_items.recipe: Mix quark cheese, mashed potatoes, flour, eggs, and sugar. Form patties and fry until golden. Serve with applesauce or powdered sugar.

food_items.name: Cupcake
food_items.recipe: Bake a vanilla or chocolate batter in paper liners at 350°F for 20 minutes. Frost with buttercream or cream cheese icing and decorate.

food_items.name: Snickerdoodle
food_items.recipe: Mix butter, sugar, flour, and eggs into a dough. Roll balls in cinnamon-sugar, then bake at 375°F for 10 minutes until soft and chewy.

food_items.name: Farl
food_items.recipe: Mix flour, baking soda, salt, and buttermilk into a dough. Shape into a round, cut into wedges, and cook on a griddle. Serve with butter.

food_items.name: Coleslaw
food_items.recipe: Shred cabbage and carrots. Mix with mayonnaise, vinegar, sugar, and salt. Chill for an hour before serving as a side dish.

food_items.name: Calas
food_items.recipe: Mix cooked rice, flour, sugar, and eggs into a batter. Deep-fry spoonfuls until golden. Dust with powdered sugar and serve warm.

food_items.name: Beef Stroganoff
food_items.recipe: Sauté beef strips with onions and mushrooms. Add sour cream and beef broth, simmer until thickened. Serve over egg noodles.

food_items.name: Shimotsukare
food_items.recipe: Cook salmon heads, soybeans, and vegetables in a soy sauce broth. Add grated daikon and simmer. Serve as a hearty stew.

food_items.name: Squab
food_items.recipe: Roast young pigeon with garlic, thyme, and butter at 400°F for 20 minutes. Serve with a side of roasted vegetables.

food_items.name: Basbousa
food_items.recipe: Mix semolina, sugar, yogurt, and butter into a batter. Bake at 350°F, then soak with sugar syrup and top with almonds.

food_items.name: Watalappam
food_items.recipe: Mix coconut milk, jaggery, eggs, and cardamom. Steam in a mold for 45 minutes. Chill and serve as a custard-like dessert.

food_items.name: Tepsi baytinijan
food_items.recipe: Layer fried eggplant, potatoes, and meatballs in a tomato sauce. Bake at 375°F until bubbly. Serve with rice.

food_items.name: Kuli-kuli
food_items.recipe: Grind roasted peanuts into a paste, mix with spices, and shape into balls or sticks. Fry until crispy. Serve as a snack.

food_items.name: Shabu-shabu
food_items.recipe: Simmer a kombu broth. Dip thin slices of beef and vegetables in the hot broth to cook. Serve with dipping sauces like ponzu.

food_items.name: Sundae
food_items.recipe: Scoop vanilla ice cream into a dish. Top with chocolate syrup, whipped cream, nuts, and a cherry. Serve immediately.

food_items.name: Fried brain sandwich
food_items.recipe: Bread and fry thin slices of calf brain. Serve on white bread with mustard, pickles, and onions.

food_items.name: Rollmops
food_items.recipe: Roll pickled herring fillets around onions or pickles. Secure with a toothpick and marinate in vinegar. Serve cold.

food_items.name: Higashi
food_items.recipe: Mix rice flour, sugar, and water. Press into molds and steam until set. Serve as a delicate, dry confection.

food_items.name: Panna cotta
food_items.recipe: Heat cream, sugar, and vanilla, then mix with gelatin. Pour into molds, chill until set, and serve with berry coulis.

food_items.name: Aloo gobi
food_items.recipe: Sauté cauliflower and potatoes with turmeric, cumin, and tomatoes. Cook until tender. Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice.

food_items.name: Aspic
food_items.recipe: Simmer meat or vegetables in broth with gelatin. Pour into a mold and chill until set. Slice and serve cold.

food_items.name: Obatzda
food_items.recipe: Mix camembert cheese, butter, paprika, and onions. Season with salt and pepper. Serve as a spread with pretzels.

food_items.name: Gulab jamun
food_items.recipe: Make dough from milk powder and flour, shape into balls, and deep-fry. Soak in cardamom-sugar syrup. Serve warm.

food_items.name: Tuna casserole
food_items.recipe: Mix cooked noodles, canned tuna, cream of mushroom soup, and peas. Top with breadcrumbs and bake at 375°F for 25 minutes.

food_items.name: Ribollita
food_items.recipe: Simmer beans, kale, tomatoes, and stale bread in vegetable broth. Cook until thick and hearty. Serve with olive oil drizzle.

food_items.name: Chomchom
food_items.recipe: Shape chhena (milk curds) into ovals, boil in sugar syrup, and coat with coconut or mawa. Serve as a sweet treat.

food_items.name: Rassolnik
food_items.recipe: Cook barley, pickles, potatoes, and meat in broth. Add pickle brine for tanginess. Serve with sour cream.

food_items.name: Jeongol
food_items.recipe: Arrange beef, mushrooms, and vegetables in a pot. Add seasoned broth and simmer at the table. Serve hot.

food_items.name: Cantonese seafood soup
food_items.recipe: Simmer shrimp, scallops, and fish in chicken broth with ginger and scallions. Add rice noodles and serve hot.

food_items.name: Eggplant Salad
food_items.recipe: Roast eggplants, peel, and mash with garlic, lemon juice, and olive oil. Garnish with parsley and serve with pita.

food_items.name: Kürtőskalács
food_items.recipe: Wrap yeast dough around a spit, coat with sugar, and bake over an open flame. Brush with butter and sprinkle with nuts.

food_items.name: Pölsa
food_items.recipe: Cook minced meat, barley, and onions in broth until thick. Season with allspice. Serve with boiled potatoes.

food_items.name: Lobster roll
food_items.recipe: Mix lobster meat with mayonnaise, lemon juice, and celery. Serve in a toasted hot dog bun with lettuce.

food_items.name: Sloppy joe
food_items.recipe: Cook ground beef with tomato sauce, onions, and spices. Spoon onto a bun and serve with pickles.

food_items.name: Schnitzel
food_items.recipe: Pound veal or pork thin, coat in flour, egg, and breadcrumbs. Fry until golden. Serve with lemon and potatoes.

food_items.name: Bacalhau
food_items.recipe: Soak salt cod, then bake with potatoes, onions, and cream. Drizzle with olive oil and serve hot.

food_items.name: Sfenj
food_items.recipe: Mix flour, yeast, and water into a sticky dough. Shape into rings, fry until golden, and dust with sugar.

food_items.name: Menudo
food_items.recipe: Simmer tripe and hominy in a red chile broth with garlic and oregano. Serve with lime, onions, and tortillas.

food_items.name: Gujia
food_items.recipe: Fill a dough of flour and ghee with sweetened khoya and nuts. Fold into half-moons, fry, and dust with sugar.

food_items.name: Liver soup
food_items.recipe: Cook sliced liver, potatoes, and carrots in beef broth. Season with herbs and serve with crusty bread.

food_items.name: Panocha
food_items.recipe: Cook sprouted wheat flour with brown sugar and water until thick. Pour into a tray, cool, and cut into squares.

food_items.name: Chakapuli
food_items.recipe: Simmer lamb with tarragon, plums, and white wine. Cook until tender. Serve with rice or bread.

food_items.name: Sklandrausis
food_items.recipe: Fill rye dough with a mixture of mashed carrots, potatoes, and sour cream. Bake until golden and serve cold.

food_items.name: Liver pâté
food_items.recipe: Blend cooked liver with butter, onions, and brandy. Season, chill, and serve as a spread with crackers.

food_items.name: Rullepølse
food_items.recipe: Flatten pork, layer with spices and herbs, roll tightly, and cure. Slice thinly and serve on rye bread.

food_items.name: Frikadeller
food_items.recipe: Mix ground pork, onions, eggs, and breadcrumbs. Shape into patties, fry until golden. Serve with potatoes.

food_items.name: Frikandel
food_items.recipe: Blend minced meat with spices, shape into sausages, and deep-fry. Serve with mustard and onions.

food_items.name: Cinnamon roll
food_items.recipe: Roll yeast dough with cinnamon-sugar and butter. Bake at 375°F, then drizzle with icing. Serve warm.

food_items.name: Scotch pie
food_items.recipe: Fill a pastry crust with minced lamb and spices. Bake until golden. Serve hot or cold.

food_items.name: Hot wiener
food_items.recipe: Grill a small hot dog, place in a bun, and top with meat sauce, onions, mustard, and celery salt.

food_items.name: Wodzionka
food_items.recipe: Soak stale bread in hot water with garlic and lard. Season with salt and serve as a simple soup.

food_items.name: Greek salad
food_items.recipe: Toss tomatoes, cucumbers, red onions, olives, and feta with olive oil, lemon juice, and oregano. Serve fresh.

food_items.name: Raita
food_items.recipe: Mix yogurt with chopped cucumber, mint, and cumin. Season with salt and serve as a cooling side.

food_items.name: Dong'an chicken
food_items.recipe: Stir-fry chicken with dried chiles, ginger, and vinegar. Add scallions and serve with rice.

food_items.name: Boortsog
food_items.recipe: Make a dough with flour, butter, and milk. Shape into small pieces, fry until golden, and dust with sugar.

food_items.name: Coca
food_items.recipe: Top a yeast dough with roasted peppers, onions, or anchovies. Bake until crispy. Serve as a flatbread.

food_items.name: Champon
food_items.recipe: Cook ramen noodles in a broth of pork, chicken, and seafood. Add cabbage and carrots. Serve hot.

food_items.name: Tabbouleh
food_items.recipe: Mix bulgur, chopped parsley, tomatoes, mint, and onions with lemon juice and olive oil. Serve chilled.

food_items.name: Korokke
food_items.recipe: Mix mashed potatoes with ground meat, coat in breadcrumbs, and fry until golden. Serve with tonkatsu sauce.

food_items.name: Chile relleno
food_items.recipe: Stuff poblano peppers with cheese or meat, dip in egg batter, and fry. Serve with tomato sauce.

food_items.name: Brandade
food_items.recipe: Blend soaked salt cod with olive oil, garlic, and cream. Bake until bubbly. Serve with bread.

food_items.name: Hoppang
food_items.recipe: Fill yeast dough with red bean paste or custard. Steam until fluffy. Serve warm.

food_items.name: Gozinaki
food_items.recipe: Mix toasted walnuts with honey, spread into a thin layer, and cool. Cut into diamond shapes.

food_items.name: Lazarakia
food_items.recipe: Shape sweet yeast dough into small figures, add raisins for eyes. Bake until golden and serve.

food_items.name: Puff Puff
food_items.recipe: Mix flour, sugar, yeast, and water into a batter. Deep-fry spoonfuls until golden. Dust with sugar.

food_items.name: Fatteh
food_items.recipe: Layer toasted pita, chickpeas, and yogurt sauce. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with pine nuts.

food_items.name: Speculaas
food_items.recipe: Mix flour, butter, brown sugar, and spices like cinnamon. Roll out, cut into shapes, and bake at 350°F.

food_items.name: Karasumi
food_items.recipe: Salt and dry mullet roe. Slice thinly and serve as a delicacy with sake or rice.

food_items.name: Brandy snaps
food_items.recipe: Bake a batter of sugar, butter, and golden syrup into thin wafers. Roll into tubes while warm.

food_items.name: Trdelník
food_items.recipe: Wrap yeast dough around a spit, coat with sugar, and bake over an open flame. Dust with cinnamon.

food_items.name: Cocido madrileño
food_items.recipe: Simmer chickpeas, beef, pork, and vegetables in broth. Serve broth first, then meats and chickpeas.

food_items.name: Red velvet cake
food_items.recipe: Bake a cocoa-flavored cake with red food coloring. Frost with cream cheese icing. Serve in slices.

food_items.name: Kringle
food_items.recipe: Layer flaky pastry with almond paste or fruit filling. Shape into an oval, bake, and drizzle with icing.

food_items.name: Quenelle
food_items.recipe: Blend fish or chicken with eggs and cream. Shape into ovals, poach in broth, and serve with sauce.

food_items.name: Toasted ravioli
food_items.recipe: Coat ravioli in breadcrumbs, deep-fry until golden. Serve with marinara sauce for dipping.

food_items.name: Tajine
food_items.recipe: Slow-cook chicken or lamb with vegetables, dried fruits, and spices in a conical pot. Serve with couscous.

food_items.name: Cranachan
food_items.recipe: Layer whipped cream, raspberries, toasted oats, and honey. Drizzle with whisky and serve chilled.

food_items.name: Rusk
food_items.recipe: Bake bread slices until dry and crisp. Serve plain or with tea for dipping.

food_items.name: Mille-feuille
food_items.recipe: Layer puff pastry with pastry cream. Top with icing or powdered sugar. Slice and serve.

food_items.name: Acorn noodle soup
food_items.recipe: Cook acorn starch noodles in beef broth with mushrooms and scallions. Season with soy sauce.

food_items.name: Gachas
food_items.recipe: Cook cornmeal or flour in milk or water until thick. Sweeten with sugar or serve savory with garlic.

food_items.name: Jingisukan
food_items.recipe: Grill lamb slices with onions and peppers on a dome-shaped grill. Serve with soy-based dipping sauce.

food_items.name: Thekua
food_items.recipe: Mix wheat flour, jaggery, and ghee into a dough. Shape into discs, fry until golden, and cool.

food_items.name: Ghugni
food_items.recipe: Cook dried peas with spices, tomatoes, and onions. Serve as a thick curry with bread or rice.

food_items.name: Tarama
food_items.recipe: Blend fish roe with olive oil, lemon juice, and bread crumbs. Serve as a creamy dip with pita.

food_items.name: Italian beef
food_items.recipe: Slow-cook beef with Italian spices, slice thinly, and serve on a roll with giardiniera and au jus.

food_items.name: Challah
food_items.recipe: Braid a dough of flour, eggs, sugar, and yeast. Bake until golden. Serve as a soft, sweet bread.

food_items.name: Fried ice cream
food_items.recipe: Coat ice cream balls in cornflakes or breadcrumbs, freeze, then quickly deep-fry. Serve with honey.

food_items.name: Onion ring
food_items.recipe: Dip thick onion slices in batter or breadcrumbs, deep-fry until golden. Serve with ketchup.

food_items.name: Smoked meat
food_items.recipe: Cure and smoke beef brisket with spices. Slice thinly and serve on rye bread with mustard.

food_items.name: Dahi vada
food_items.recipe: Soak lentil dumplings in yogurt, top with tamarind chutney and spices. Serve chilled.

food_items.name: Mother-in-law
food_items.recipe: Fill a bun with a tamale, chili, and cheese. Top with onions and serve hot.

food_items.name: Blondie
food_items.recipe: Mix brown sugar, butter, flour, and eggs. Bake in a pan at 350°F, cut into squares, and serve.

food_items.name: Guk
food_items.recipe: Simmer beef, seaweed, or vegetables in water or broth. Season with soy sauce and serve with rice.

food_items.name: Hiyashi chūka
food_items.recipe: Top cold ramen noodles with cucumber, ham, egg, and tomato. Drizzle with soy-vinegar dressing.

food_items.name: Sweet shells
food_items.recipe: Fill fried pastry shells with sweetened ricotta or custard. Dust with powdered sugar and serve.

food_items.name: Salisbury steak
food_items.recipe: Shape ground beef into patties, fry, and simmer in mushroom gravy. Serve with mashed potatoes.

food_items.name: Poffertjes
food_items.recipe: Cook small yeast batter pancakes in a special pan. Dust with powdered sugar and serve with butter.

food_items.name: Eggs Neptune
food_items.recipe: Place poached eggs and crab meat on an English muffin, top with hollandaise sauce. Serve warm.

food_items.name: Galbi-jjim
food_items.recipe: Braise beef short ribs with soy sauce, garlic, and sugar. Add carrots and potatoes. Serve hot.

food_items.name: Agwi-jjim
food_items.recipe: Steam monkfish with bean sprouts and red pepper paste. Garnish with scallions and serve.

food_items.name: Ladob
food_items.recipe: Cook plantains and sweet potatoes in coconut milk with sugar and nutmeg. Serve as a sweet stew.

food_items.name: Instant-boiled mutton
food_items.recipe: Slice mutton thinly, dip in boiling broth to cook, and serve with sesame paste and chili oil.

food_items.name: Cincalok
food_items.recipe: Ferment small shrimp with rice and salt. Use as a condiment with rice or seafood dishes.

food_items.name: Jook-sing noodles
food_items.recipe: Beat rice flour dough with a bamboo log, shape into noodles, and cook in broth. Serve with pork.

food_items.name: Potbrood
food_items.recipe: Bake a yeast dough in a cast-iron pot over coals until crusty. Serve with butter or stew.

food_items.name: Burkinabe cuisine
food_items.recipe: Cook rice with vegetables and peanut sauce. Serve with grilled chicken or fish.

food_items.name: Taralli
food_items.recipe: Boil rings of flour, water, and olive oil dough, then bake until crispy. Season with fennel or pepper.

food_items.name: Carbonade flamande
food_items.recipe: Braise beef in beer with onions and mustard. Simmer until tender. Serve with fries.

food_items.name: Xôi
food_items.recipe: Steam glutinous rice, top with mung bean paste or peanuts. Serve sweet or savory.

food_items.name: Sauerbraten
food_items.recipe: Marinate beef in vinegar and spices for days, then braise. Serve with red cabbage and dumplings.

food_items.name: Spiedie

food_items.name: Cawl
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 500g lamb or beef, diced
- 2 large potatoes, peeled and chopped
- 2 carrots, sliced
- 1 leek, sliced
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 swede (rutabaga), diced
- 2 tbsp flour
- 1.5 liters water or stock
- Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:
1. Brown the meat in a large pot, then remove and set aside.
2. Fry the onions and leeks until soft, then stir in the flour.
3. Return the meat to the pot, add water/stock, and bring to a boil.
4. Add all vegetables except potatoes and simmer for 1.5 hours.
5. Add potatoes and cook for another 30 minutes until tender.
6. Season and serve with crusty bread.

food_items.name: Kushari
food_items.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 1 cup brown lentils
- 1 cup short-grain rice
- 1 cup elbow macaroni
- 2 medium onions, thinly sliced
- 2 tbsp vegetable oil
- 2 cups tomato sauce
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tbsp white vinegar
- 1/2 tsp cumin
- 1/2 tsp chili flakes (optional)
- Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:
1. Cook lentils in salted water until just tender (about 20 minutes). Drain and set aside.
2. Rinse rice and cook in 2 cups of water with a pinch of salt. Once done, fluff and set aside.
3. Cook macaroni in salted boiling water until al dente. Drain and set aside.
4. In a large skillet, heat 1 tbsp oil and fry sliced onions until dark brown and crispy. Remove and drain on paper towels.
5. In a saucepan, heat 1 tbsp oil and sauté garlic until golden. Add tomato sauce, vinegar, cumin, chili flakes, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 10–15 minutes.
6. In a large bowl or plate, layer rice, then lentils, then pasta. Top with tomato sauce and garnish with crispy fried onions.

Note: Approximately 360 calories per serving (based on a medium portion).
